1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The Big Apple

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Our Christmas celebration in New York was everything we were promised.

First on the agenda was the Radio City Christmas Spectacular. Music to thrill the ear. Dancing to dazzle the eye. And the Whites were moved to tears by the live Nativity.

We spent the day of Christmas Eve ice skating at Rockefeller Center, under the big tree. Nobody cared how many times anybody fell down, the important thing was to get back up and try again.

For the night before Christmas, Lin-Manuel Miranda rented a banquet hall for us to use to exchange gifts. It didn't matter who got what, it was the togetherness that mattered to us.

"It's going to be hard to top this Christmas," Mom said.

"Next year will be better," Sarah replied.

"How can you tell?"

"Because, next year, we'll be celebrating with our babies."

"Hear, hear," I replied.

******************************


Meanwhile, elsewhere in Manhattan, Max Grimm sat alone in his office on Christmas Eve.

"Mr. Grimm," said his secretary over the intercom, "Mr. Creed is on Line 1. He has some questions about some expenditures."

"Yes," Grimm replied, "I'm sure he does."

Grimm took the call, then hung up before his partner could say a word.

After staring out the window for some time, Grimm opened his desk drawer, his eyes settling on two items in particular: A ticket for Gaia and a .44 rifle.

If you want something done right in this world, he thought, you've damn well got to do it yourself.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Christmas in New York City

choices: Pop catches the bullet and throws it back
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The time had finally come for us to perform 'Gaia' in the famous Play House Theater. We were all nervous and excited at the same time. It had become more than a just a play or a movement, Gaia had become a phenomenon among 'Save the Earth' advocates all over the world. Lin smiled at us as we stepped out of the dressing rooms, ready for the first act we had called 'Too Late Realization'.

"This is it, people." Serious, Lin said. "Everything you have all worked so hard for is about to come full circle."

"More than you realize." Carefully, Ms Switch whispered.

We all smiled at that, to which Lin merely shrugged. "I'm going to give a short speech before the performance, so sit tight for a moment." Smiling, he said. "I want this production to get the proper introduction, so to send our message loud and clear."

With that, he marched out onto the stage. Curious, I peeked out from stage right and found the theater completely packed. I had never before seen so many people in one place. it sent my excitement and nervousness to a whole new level. Brooklynne looked out at the audience and smiled. "Take my advice." Kindly, she whispered. "Do not look at the audience, look beyond them to the entire world, as that is who our message is aimed at."

I nodded, smiling. "Thanks..."

"The Industrial Revolution began in 1760." Serious, Lin began. "This was also when we humans began to seriously pollute our precious planet." He frowned. " The domestic petroleum industry began in 1859, with a well drilled just 69.5 feet deep. This forever changed America's economy, standard of living, and culture, with the rest of the world soon following." Lin sighed and walked away from the podium. "Ladies and gentlemen, it has only taken us roughly one hundred and sixty years to destabilize what took billions of years to create. Gaia is a deep look into what we may face if we do not change our ways, and soon."

With that, he walked off the stage, with a stage hand taking away the podium. As Lin passed us, he whispered, "They're all yours, kids... break a leg."

We nodded, not only moved by Lin's speech, but determined to get our message across to the entire world. The opening music began to play and we walked onto the stage with the audience greeting us with an applause. Once all was quiet, we began our production, with Mr Dietrich playing a rich oil tycoon in his office, singing 'It's Too Late' with other actors playing the roles of his yes men...

They say it's too late!

We've ignored the warnings for far too long
The realization has panic all around
We prepared for things to go awry
But now we've set fire to the sky
Here they come, the mob with rage in their eyes!

They say it's too late!

We've burned our bridges and crossed the line
Sealed our fate, claiming all is fine...

So we need to save the world before there is no way back
One disaster at a time, we can make a backwards track
You know we lose time waiting for someone to start
Lets all work together with all of our hearts!

It's not too late though time is quickly running out!
We're all going to change how we do things
Gaia will be reborn like a phoenix...!

The rest of the production went on without a single hitch before I played the ending with the song, 'Little Baby'...

Little baby, please understand
I won't be there for you
When you become a man
This generation may be the last, we fear
Unless we reach another world so near
We need them so... hear our woe...

Take these broken dreams
And lift our hopes up again
Of a life lived so free
When we hear the angels sing
We'll know Earth has opened up their arms
And let us in

Little baby, a kiss goodbye
I must leave to right the wrongs
To give you a better life
Little baby, it's all we have to hold
A desperate plan to save our race
So pray for the brave and bold
We rely on them so...

Take these broken dreams
And lift our hopes up again
From extinction, we'll be free
And when we hear the angels sing
We'll know Earth has opened up their arms
And let us in...

Unknown to all, Maximilian Grimm watched the production from a high booth, with a .44 rifle with a silencer attached at the ready, waiting for just the right moment. As I sang the final verse of the last song, Grimm took careful aim at me. Only I did not realize he was not aiming for me, but my unborn child. "This will stop you from ever singing again..." Coldly, he whispered. He took a breath and pulled the trigger.

From stage left, Pop was watching me alone on the stage, and caught something out of the corner of his eye. He turned and saw the lights reflecting off of Grimm's scope. With no time to think, he charged out onto the stage. I turned, seeing him, and gasped, just as the rifle was fired...
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Heading Out to Perform

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"POP!"

For a moment, I could let myself believe that he was okay, that there was nothing wrong.

When the moment passed, though, Pop's shirt began to turn red.

I fell to his side, pressing my hand on the awful hole. "Stay with us, Pop," I begged. "I need you. JD needs you."

Pop opened his eyes.

They were blue, and glowing.

"I'll be alright, Cass," he said. "You've got a job to do. Always finish what you start, remember?"

I wasn't fully sure what was going on, but Pop's advice had never steered me wrong before. I put my emotions into my song, then stayed at Pop's side until he was in the hands of the EMTs.

I let myself fall into the arms of Ms. Switch. After what felt like forever, but was probably just moments, I whispered, "He... He's Gaian... "

"That's why he insists people call him Pop," she whispered back. "Pahp, in our language, means hope."

There was some commotion in one of the luxury booths, but I couldn't worry about that right now. Pop was right. Our message was more important. I said as much to Lin, when he suggested we reschedule.

A police officer approached me. "Miss Pennant," she said, "we want you to know that the suspect is in custody." She shook her head. "If I hadn't seen it for myself, I never would have believed it was him."

"Who is it?"

"Maximilian Grimm."

I nodded. "I have no trouble believing it's him."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Pop takes the bullet.

choices: Billionaire Maximilian Grimm to face federal charges.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Despite the attempt upon my life, my friends and I performed Gaia one more time that night, with an encore performance after each show. Once the show was over for the night, we all changed into our street clothes and raced to the hospital where they had taken Pop. I was not surprised to see the four scientists dressed as doctors there, taking over his care.

"Pop will pull through nicely." Calmly, Mr Smith assured me. "It takes far more than a .44 caliber bullet to stop a Gaian."

"I want to see him." Serious, I demanded.

"I want to see him, too." Tearful, Pat said. "He's our pop."

Mr. Smith sighed. "Briefly... he needs his rest."

Pat and I hurried past the curtains to find Pop in a hospital bed, with his chest bandaged and a vitals monitor hooked up to him. I could not help but cry, seeing him there. "That bullet was meant for me, Pop..." Crying, I said.

Pop smiled. "You don't have a vital bone plate like I do." Softly, he said. "It's like a shield of bone over a Gaian's heart and lungs, rather than separate bars of bones you would call a rib cage." He chuckled before wincing. "It stopped the bullet, but it stings like a club-dog."

"A what?" confused, I asked.

"It's kind of like a sheep dog, but with a clubbed tail."

Pat winced before saying, "Cassie said you are a Gaian... does that mean I'm...."

Pop nodded. "You are half-Gaian, which was how the others were able to change you." Calmly, he said. "Paht in our language means Valor."

"The police caught Maximilian Grimm." Softly, I said. "He will pay for his crimes."

Pop nodded. "Of that, I am quite certain." Firmly but kindly, he said. "All of the parents have notified their attorneys of the situation, and a class action lawsuit is in order, along with criminal charges we intend to press against him."

Pat began to cry. "Pop,... you're going to be okay... right...?" Her eyes glowed a bright blue, before returning to their original green color.

Seeing this, Pop chuckled. "Keep your emotions in check, Pat." Scolding slightly, he said. "You still need to learn to control your natural talents." He then turned to me. "That goes for you as well, young lady. "You will be part Gaian, too, once your son is born."

"Your time is up, kids." Firmly but kindly, Mr Smith said. "Pop will be back in action before the next performance, but we will have extra security set up, just in case."

The following morning, I looked at the headlines on the newspaper, it read...
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Visiting Pop

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
I grunted with satisfaction. He wound up doing to himself what he accused us of trying to do to him: he destroyed his own wealth and power. "That's what you get," I said aloud, "for shooting my Pop."

"Easy, tiger," Pop said, as he checked his appearance in the mirror. "You sound like I'm not about to walk out of here."

"If you weren't," I replied, "the headlines about Grimm would have been different."

"Yeah," Pat said, "and Cassie and I would both be in jail."

"Enough talk about that," Mom said. "The three of you forget, I would have had to deal with what you're brushing off."

"You're right, honey," Pop said, kissing her. "Let's talk about the real news from last night. What do they say about the show?"

"That's below the fold," I said, turning the paper over. "Massive hit. Streaming views were through the roof."

"And that was the second show," Pat said, "so nobody outside the theater saw what happened."

A nurse brought in a wheelchair. "What's this?" Pop asked.

"Hospital regulations," the nurse replied. "You have to check out in a wheelchair, so you don't trip over something and have to be re-admitted."

"Well, I wouldn't want to miss the second night," Pop said, sitting down in the wheelchair.

"Are you two girls the ones from Gaia?" the nurse asked. Pulling out the Playbill for the show, she asked, "Could I get your autographs? You know, for my niece."

"Sure," I said, taking her pen. "What's your niece's name?"

"Uh,... Tara," said the nurse, whose name was Tara.

I made it out to Tara, and included an inspirational message from the play. Pat did the same.

When we left the room, we found the whole cast and crew waiting for us, too impatient even to wait downstairs. They gushed over Pop, who assured them that he would be out of the wheelchair as soon as he was outside.

"Excuse me, excuse me," called someone.

"Let them through, girls," Pop said.

To my surprise, the man who wanted to get through was coming to us. "Allow me to introduce myself," he said. "My name is Nathan Creed. Max Grimm was my business partner."

"What brings you here to see me, Mr. Creed?"

"We would like to apologize for what happened," Mr. Creed said. "Grimm's actions were taken without any knowledge from myself or the board of directors. In fact, I have been spending the week investigating the monies he was spending left and right. I woke up this morning to my attorney informing me that the board had unanimously voted to rename the company Creed Energy Solutions. If there's anything I can do, Mr. Pennant, just name it."

"There's one thing," Lauren said, pulling out the plans for the AAP. "Your predecessor was completely uninterested in this, said he built the company on oil, not alternative energy sources."

Mr. Creed took the plans. "We're very much interested."

"There will be some familiar faces looking for jobs working on that," I said.

"If it's the four I'm thinking of," he replied, "they're hired as soon as they come in."

I put my hands over my womb. It's happening, JD, I thought. Our dream, the Gaians' dream, is coming true.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Billionaire Maximilian Grimm To Face Federal Ch...

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Maybe it was knowing how much Gaia meant to Pop. Maybe it was all the hard work we'd put into it. Or maybe it was just the fact that nobody tried to kill anybody. Whatever the reason, the second night of shows couldn't have gone better.

I knew it was traditional to give the director a bouquet of roses after the final show, but it still surprised me when Lin brought me back onstage to receive them. I was also surprised by how loudly the audience cheered.

Backstage, Lin said, "I hope last night didn't put you off on New York, because I think you're going to be asked to come back for the Tonys in June."

"I'm sorry, we can't come," I said. "We're not afraid, it's just that, between school and our due dates, June is not a good travel month. Could you go in our place, Lin?"

"Milady, I would be honored," he said with a bow.

"May I ask you something, Lin? Are you... ?" I pointed up.

He grinned and shook his head. "Born and bred on Earth. But I've met one before last night." Turning to Ms. Switch, he said, "Thank you for introducing me to this young lady."

"Thank you for your help, Lin," she replied. "We couldn't have done it without you."

******************************


So, what with Christmas in New York, the play, finding out that Pop was Gaian, and a prediction of Tony nominations, which was the most awe-inspiring moment of winter break? For Pat and me, the answer is "None of the above."

No, for us, the most awe-inspiring moment was looking at the ultrasound, showing us our babies for the first time.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: One Last Bow

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
It was about two-thirds of the way through January. I woke up, rubbed the sleep out of my eyes, sat up, and looked down. "Hello... "

I got out of bed and went to the mirror, lifting my top. There was no doubt about it. I had an official baby bump.

I took a picture and posted it, with the caption, "#bumped".

"Cassie," Pat called through my door, "you up?"

"I'm up."

She opened the door and stood in profile, showing off her own bump. "Notice anything?"

"Nice. Check out mine." On a whim, we bumped bumps.

Over breakfast, when we weren't rubbing our own bellies, we rubbed each other's. Except for when we checked our phones, getting bump pictures from Lauren and Sarah.

Pop shrugged. "I guess this is what you get when there's two mothers-to-be under one roof."

She leaned and whispered into his ear. "Oh."

"What did you just say to Pop?" Pat asked.

"Nothing important," Mom replied. "Finish your breakfast, or you'll be late for school."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Baby Bumps

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Pat and I went to school, thrilled to be in maternity clothes. Other girls cooed over us, and some of them politely asked if they could touch our bellies. Sometimes, I said yes. Usually, Pat said no.

One thing that made both of us smile, however, was when Kevin and Jimmy spotted us.

"Do you remember me?" Kevin asked me.

"Vividly," I replied.

"The last time I asked you out," he said, "you said no to a second date, because you needed to concentrate on your play."

"Of course. I had only intended for Gaia to be a high school play. Next thing I know, I'm taking it to New York, at the request of Lin-Manuel Miranda."

"Completely understandable. My point is, you are no longer working on the play, and I still want to take you out."

"I'm sorry. I guess I've been a bad girlfriend. Where should we go?"

"Dinner and a movie worked the first time. And, this time, you'll be rocking a baby bump."

"You do know how to tempt a girl. Okay, what's the movie?"

"How about that new one, with the shrinking?"

"And the time?"

"How about Friday at 6:00?"

"It's a date."

The next time I saw Pat, it was clear that Jimmy had asked her out, too. And that she'd said yes.

And, this time, nobody would be trying to spoil the evening.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Romance in the Air

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Upon reaching the movies to get our tickets, I was in for a surprise. All of our friends had dates of their own, heading to different movies. Most of them I knew from school. Darla was going out with Stan, to see the movie Gift From the Skies, a mystery about a group of teenagers who receive the gift of flight from an ancient Egyptian God. Lauren and Sarah were going out with the Rafferty twins, Mike and Bill. They were going to see Witch Academy, a drama romance about a school that taught witches how to responsibly work magic. Brooklynne and her newly formed guardians, Nicole, Gretchen, Darci, and Gwen, were going out with members of the senior football team to see the new movie, Problem Child, an action movie about super-powered teens out to save the world.

"It looks like we all decided to accept dates for this evening." Smiling, I said.

Brooklynne giggled. "At least we're not all seeing the same movie." Bemused, she said. "We'll all have our chance for a little privacy."

I blushed at that before turning to Pat. "What movie are you and Jimmy seeing?"

Pat blushed before replying, "My Life in Miniature, same as you and Stewart. Pop bought out the show, so we would have the theater to ourselves."

I blushed more at that before Brooklynne nodded. "My dad did the same for us."

The movie was wonderful,... what we got to see of it. Kevin and I were more interested in each other than the action on the screen, and I could only assume the same was for Pat and Jimmy. We had the whole theater to ourselves, and we loved every minute of it,... literally.

"I had a wonderful time." Blushing, I said after the movie. "Where to next?"

Kevin smiled. "My house." Surprising me, he said. "You are getting a home-cooked meal tonight, courtesy of the Stewart family." Seeing my surprise, he added, "I got to meet your parents, now it's your turn to meet mine."

How could I refuse? Jimmy was taking Pat to meet his parents, and the same for the others. "Good luck with Stan's parents, Darla." Grinning I said.

Darla giggled. "He's a little angel and I'm a little devil." Teasing, she replied. "Opposites attract."

Stan chuckled at that. "My kind of girl..."

We all had a good laugh at that, and parted ways to finish our dates. Kevin drove me to his house, after calling Pop to tell him where we were going, and I came face to face with his parents, Joshua and Francis Stewart. "Top of the evening to you, lassie." With a heavy Scottish accent, Mr Stewart said. "I can see the apple does not fall far from the tree, my son has good taste."

I blushed at that but giggled as Mrs Stewart lightly smacked him on the back of the head. "Behave yourself in front of our guests." Scolding, she said. "I did not slave over a hot stove for your pride or ego."

Mr Stewart tried to wince and pout, but I could tell he was chuckling underneath it... the two were no doubt still very much in love with each other. Kevin shrugged. "He likes how she fights."

"Come forth, child." Kindly, Mrs Steward said. "Get to know us better."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Date Night

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
I decided to start. "What brought you to the States, Mr. Stewart?"

"Why, she did," he replied with a chuckle, indicating his wife.

"I went to Scotland to research my family tree," she explained. "His family ran a pub where I rented a room."

"Stole my heart, she did. I couldn't bear to be without her."

"I was a tougher sell. That is, until he turned his puppy-dog eyes on me."

"What do you do now?"

"Och, you're nae interested in my job, lass."

"But I am, Mr. Stewart. I'm interested in your son, so I want to know about his family. Now, what do you do?"

"I'm in the hospitality trade. Just recently started a new job, pays well."

"Sounds ideal. May I ask where?"

He turned his eyes to me, and I could see what his wife was talking about. "Dinna make me say it, lass."

"I must know."

He sighed, defeated. "I manage the Stardust Hotel."

"Ah. You know I couldn't possibly hold you responsible for that."

"Still," Mrs. Stewart said, "we thought it might be a tender subject."

"Listen, two of my friends started out as unfriendly rivals." I rubbed my belly. "I want my baby to know nothing but love growing up. That's how I'm handling this. I'm happy that the Stardust is in such capable hands as yours, Mr. Stewart, and I wish you nothing but success." I got up and hugged the big old bear.

Some time later, after I told Pop that Kevin's father was the manager of the Stardust, he called to congratulate the Stewarts on raising a fine boy.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Dinner with the Stewart family.

choices: Our friends see the doctor next.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The time had come to see Dr. Kyrl Foster again. Pop made the appointment, then drove Pat and me to go see her. As expected, she had a baby bump, too. We greeted each other by rubbing each other's bumps, even Pat allowed Dr. Foster to touch hers. Normally, she would not let anyone but those she knew very well. "I know what that sort of behavior means on Gaia." Bemused, Kyrl said. "Only, I have to confirm it, as we are on Earth."

Thus, the ultrasound was brought out. "You'll need to be careful who you show these pictures to, as this machine has been modified with Gaian technology."

I was first. A cool gel was spread over my belly before the flat probe was gently rubbed across it. Curious, I looked at the monitor before letting out a soft coo. There he was, tiny little Jonathan Donald Pennant. "Hey there, kiddo..." Gushing, I whispered. "It's me, your mommy..."

The fetus reacted by moving a little, which caused me to giggle. "I think he heard me."

Kyrl smiled.

"The picture's in color," Pat said.

"As I said, it's been modified. Don't worry, I'll give you black-and-white copies, too, for those who you aren't ready to tell."

As I cleaned myself off, it was Pat's turn. She giggled slightly as the gel was spread onto her belly, then watched the monitor with curiosity as the probe was gently moved over the gel. A gasp escaped her lips before she teared up, blushing as she cooed at the monitor. Looking over her shoulder, I let out a short giggle... "Twins!"

Sure enough, there were two tiny little ones inside Pat's womb. "I'm having twin girls." Blushing, Pat whispered. "Oy vey!"

"Congratulations to you both, girls." Smiling, Kyrl said. "Thus far, your children are perfectly healthy, as are you both."

"Have you seen your child yet?" Curious, I asked.

Kyrl blushed profusely before nodding. "I have, with the help of Ms Switch." Softly, she replied.

"And... ?" anxious, Pat asked.

Kyrl giggled. "I'm having twins, too."

We all shared a hug before Kyrl provided us with a number of pictures of our developing children.

Pat and I left the doctor's office, feeling more than elated as we proudly held pictures of our upcoming children. Pop noticed our good moods upon picking us up. "I take it you received good news from Dr Foster?" Smiling, he said.

Pat nodded. "Cassie is having a baby boy, and I'm having twin girls."

Pop's jaw dropped slightly before he smiled. "Seriously, Pat? Twins... ?"

Pat nodded and showed him the pictures.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Appointment with Dr. Foster

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The next day, we brought our ultrasound pictures to share. A few of the other pregnant girls had ultrasounds, too, but Pat, the youngest and smallest, was the only one who was having twins.

The cooing of the Sisterhood caught the attention of our boyfriends. "What's going on?" Kevin asked.

"Ultrasounds," I replied, showing him mine. "That's my little boy."

"Cool."

"Isn't he amazing?"

"Gets it from his mom."

If that remark didn't earn a kiss, Kevin got one anyway.

That kiss was interrupted by a sudden noise which got our attention. A crowd was forming. "Clear aside!" Lauren said. "He needs air!"

I went over to Pat. "He fainted," she said with a shrug.

When Jimmy came to, I pulled Kevin aside. "Meet me at my house after school," I said.

"What for?"

"There's something very important I need to tell you."

"There's nothing wrong with the baby, is there?"

"The baby's fine. But I'm serious about you, and I think you're serious about me, and there's something you should know before we get seriously serious."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Our boyfriends' reactions.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"Welcome, Kevin," Mom said, as he arrived. "Can I get you a soda?"

"Yes, ma'am, thank you," he replied. "Cassie asked me to meet her here?"

"Yes, we know. Cassie's in the living room."

I was glad Mom and Pop suggested we do it this way. Everything being nice and normal, we hoped, would take the edge off of what I was going to tell him.

When he entered the living room, I was waiting on the sofa. "Hi, Kevin."

Kevin sat down just in time for Mom to put his soda can in front of him. "So, what do you want to talk about?"

This is it. "You know my play?"

"Of course I do. It's great. Everybody wants to know how you came up with it."

"Well, I really didn't come up with it."

"What do you mean?"

"Gaia was a true story. It was a real planet, and people really lived there. They rendered it uninhabitable by pollution, and they came to Earth to try again. And an important part of their plan was to implant their offspring within young women." I indicated my belly.

"But... but you said it was the substitute teachers... "

"That story was created to protect us. The substitute teachers were Gaians, and it was their mission to implant Gaian offspring within us. And they're not the only Gaians on Earth. My obstetrician is Gaian. So is Ms. Switch."

"So am I," Pop said.

Kevin turned to me. "Why are you telling me this?"

"Because... because I love you, Kevin. I love you, and I want you to be a part of my life, and a part of my son's life. But you need to know what that means." I held his hand. "So, there you have it. You can be a part of this. Or you can get out now. The choice is yours."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Telling Kevin

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Kevin placed his free hand onto mine and looked directly into my eyes.. "I did not give you the first date of a lifetime, and take you to meet my parents, just to be frightened off." Serious, he said. "I was at the Stardust Hotel when the blue lights came."

Now it was my turn to be surprised. "What?!"

"My father is not just the new manager, he's the owner." Calmly, Kevin explained. "I was helping the workers construct the hotel, and was given a deluxe suite to sleep in." he sighed. "I couldn't sleep, so I sort of patrolled the halls. That's when the blue lights came."

"What happened?" Curious, Pop asked.

"I followed the blue lights all around the hotel, and saw that it had entered all of your rooms." Frowning, Kevin said. "I tried to wake Dad, but one of the blue lights hit me. The next thing I knew, it was morning, and the hotel was empty."

"Why didn't you or he say anything, then or now?" Curious, I asked.

Kevin sighed. "Would you have believed it if he or I told you that a blue light from the sky flew through you and then left?" Softly, he countered. "When I learned you were pregnant, I put two and two together, and just knew that someone had to look after you." He then gave me a kiss. "I'm glad I did."

I kissed him back, smiling. "Me, too."

"How do you think JImmy will react?" Wincing, Pat asked.

"He'll likely faint again." Smiling slightly, I said.

Minutes later, as I had predicted, Pat told Jimmy the truth, and he fainted. Fortunately, he was quicker to recover and, like Kevin, vowed to stay at Pat's side. "I love you, and nothing, of this Earth or any other world, is going to change that."

It wasn't exactly poetry, but Pat blushed nonetheless, and the two kissed. Our relationships became that much stronger.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: True gentlemen.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
That weekend, we invited Lauren over, with her sketchbook. "What do you need from me?" she asked.

"Well," I replied, "we're designing the nursery, and we thought a Gaian landscape would make a good mural."

Her eyes lit up. I had the art in my head, but Lauren was the artist. "Let's see the wall."

We brought her to what had been the upstairs guest bedroom, but was being converted. Pop had primed the walls already, giving Lauren a blank canvas. After studying the wall, she pulled out a few sketches. "Which would you like?"

Pat and I selected one, and Lauren began drawing it on the wall. "This is a great idea," she said. "I'm going to do it for my nursery."

When her drawing was complete, she stepped back with us to take it in. "It's lovely, Lauren," I said. "Pop's got his work cut out for him, getting this right."

"I can help," she replied. "So can my boyfriend. I, uh, told him about the Gaians, and he stuck by me. He's interested in this, so he'd love the chance to put it in practice."

"Pat and I told our boyfriends, too," I said. "Kevin's dad owns the Stardust, and he was there that night. He's been looking out for us since." We've chosen our suitors well, I thought. They will make good fathers for our children.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Preparing the nursery.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The following morning, I walked into the kitchen, with my stomach grumbling so loudly, I had to giggle as I spoke to my unborn son. "Are you hungry too, little one?" Whispering, I asked.

Pat giggled. "Well, we do have more than one mouth to feed." Grinning, she replied.

I turned and giggled again, seeing Pat working on two pieces of toast, each with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream on them. "I see you have a sweet tooth this morning." Teasing, I said.

"We have a sweet tooth this morning." Smiling, Pat said.

I nodded, then started working on some rice. As it was nearing a boil, I chopped up some pickles and added them to it. "I have a taste for something a bit more sour."

We both turned, hearing Mom giggling. "Here I thought craving celery in a peanut butter and jelly sandwich was a bit strange." Bemused, she said. "That was when I was having you, Cassie."

"Why do we get such strange cravings?" Turning off the stove, I asked.

"Well, hormones, for one." Patiently, Mom replied. "Also, a heightened sense of smell and taste, and nutritional deficiencies." She shrugged. "They can hit anytime during pregnancy. Which reminds me, I have to see Dr. Foster today."

This surprised both Pat and I. We turned to each other, then asked in unison, "Um... why... ?"

Mom blushed. "Why do you think...?"
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Cravings

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"You're pregnant?" I asked.

"How?" asked Pat.

Mom arched her eyebrow. "The way you girls got pregnant isn't how it's usually done. You do know what that usual way is, don't you?"

"Okay, we don't mean that how," I said.

"I think it was the night of your first date. We had the house to ourselves. Pop put the radio on, and there it was: Our song. One thing led to another, and I have an appointment with Dr. Foster."

I sat down. "My mom's going to have a baby." I turned to her. "Who's going to take care of all these babies?"

"It's not just us, you know," Mom said. "I have relatives, there's Pop's adoptive family. And I'm sure your boyfriend Kevin's family will help."

"I suppose you're right," I said. "Well, we're here for you, if you have any questions."

"If I have questions? Need I remind you, this isn't my first pregnancy?"

"But it's your first Gaian pregnancy. There are subtle differences. You'll know what you're having before your first trimester is over."

Mom nodded. "I suppose we can teach each other."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Our reactions.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"Miss Pennant," Ms. Switch said, "I'd like to see you in my office."

"Yes, ma'am." For the life of me, I couldn't think of why Ms. Switch wanted to talk to me. There had been requests to put on a touring production of Gaia, but I wanted little to no involvement with that. I'd kept my grades up (even though half my friends were dealing with pregnancy brain, like I was). And I'd kept up involvement in school matters. What, then, did she want to talk to me about?

"Have a seat, will you?" she said. "You're probably wondering why I asked you here."

I nodded.

"It's not a disciplinary matter, I assure you. The local paper has asked me to inquire if you would like to write an advice column."

"An advice column? Me? What could I possibly be qualified to give advice about?"

"Look down, and you'll have your answer. You are the most prominent pregnant teen in our community. The paper wants you to answer questions that other girls in your condition have. It pays well, and you can always call on Dr. Foster for expert advice."

I leaned back. "What a scary thought, people wanting advice from me on any - Oh!"

"What is it?"

"I... I felt the baby move."

******************************


"What's it feel like?" Trish asked.

"It's kind of like a fish flicking its tail," I replied.

"Can I feel it?" Kevin asked.

"Not yet. It's just between JD and his mommy right now."

"So what about the column?" Pat asked.

"I think I have to," I said, rubbing where I felt my son moving. "It's like he was giving me a vote of confidence."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: First Movement

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
My first column was emailed to my editor, so I had the weekend free. And, since Kevin and I were currently canoodling in the living room, I thought it was as good a time as any to discuss something important.

"Can I talk to you about something?" I pulled my lips away from his to ask.

"Am I doing something wrong?" he asked.

God, no. "It's about the baby."

"What do you need?"

"A birthing partner. Would you - "

"When do classes start?"

"Next month."

"I'll be there. Count on it."

I don't know which made me happier, Kevin coming to birthing classes with me, or Kevin driving me wild with his kisses.

Mom and Pat came into the room. "Come on, Cassie," Mom said. "We've got to pick out your prom dresses."

"Crap, that was today?!" Even when I wrote things down, I could forget them. Getting up out of Kevin's lap, I said, "Be here when I come back."

"Not going anywhere, baby," he replied.

I joined Mom and Pat, my mood buoyed by Kevin calling me baby.

******************************


At the dress shop, the sales rep took one look at Pat and me, and said, "Let me guess: You need prom dresses with Empire waists."

"Yes on the prom dresses," Pat replied, "but what's an Empire waist?"

"The waist is directly under the breasts," she explained, "so there's plenty of room for growth. Since prom is two months away, you'll want that."

That did sound good, so we got our preliminary measurements and picked out our colors: fuchsia for me, periwinkle for Pat.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Birthing Classes and Prom Dresses

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
By the time prom night came along, it was obvious that both Pat and I won the role of Prom Queen by a landslide vote. Not only did we help the school in many ways, we helped the entire community, and all of our friends got dubbed our court. We would be dancing with our dates at the first and last song of the evening. Kevin showed up precisely on time, with Jimmy right behind him, both in dashing black tuxes. The two of them first greeted Mom and Pop before placing the corsages onto our wrists. "Your chariot awaits, my lady." Bowing, Kevin said. "Hear my soul speak. Of the very instant that I saw you, did my heart fly at your service."

I blushed at that. "You are such the romantic..." softly, I said.

Jimmy rolled his eyes, then bowed before Pat. "You and I rock no other, Pat." Smiling, he said. "Let's wake up this sleepy town."

Pat giggled. "You sure know how to charm a lady..." Smiling, she said.

Jimmy shrugged. "Shakespeare has been done to death." Honestly, he said. "Talking from the heart carries more weight."

"This is not a competition, you two." Bemused, Mom said.

Pop chuckled. "With boys, everything is a competition." Smiling, he said. He then turned to the boys. "I want my daughter and stepdaughter home no later than eleven. Is that clear?"

Kevin and Jimmy nodded before escorting us to two separate limousines that took us to the school prom. There, we were in for a surprise... What we were expecting to be a normal high school prom had become a media extravaganza. There were film crews everywhere. Kevin and I were bombarded by camera flashes and shouts from reporters. Fortunately, two security guards escorted Kevin and me into the school, with Jimmy and Pat right behind us.

"What is that all about?!" Startled, I demanded once inside.

Ms Switch walked up to Pat and me with a sigh. "Literally every motion picture agency is fighting over rights to make a movie out of Gaia." Patiently, she explained. "The media is all over it."

"But I thought we gave all the rights to Lin." Confused, I said.

"Not officially on paper, you haven't." Serious, Ms Switch said. "He is here to talk to you about it, before any other company can get to you."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Prom Night Madness.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Lin and I agreed to table the negotiations until the next day. "I'll handle the circus," he said. "Go enjoy your night."

We certainly did.

The live band surprised us by playing "Gaia" as we entered. Fortunately, the first dance number was a lot more lively, and I was grateful to Kevin for giving me dance lessons when he wasn't checking my tonsils with his tongue.

We danced a few more times that night, but mostly we sat. Even in flats, a pregnant body doesn't have the stamina to burn up the dance floor.

The official coronation dances were, by tradition, slow, so the King and Queen could make a romantic picture. Since Pat's King was Jimmy, and mine was Kevin, that made it all the sweeter.

Finally, the last dance was danced, and the prom royalty bid their subjects goodnight. "I had a wonderful time," I said as we got back into the limo.

"We've got another hour," Kevin replied. "The night doesn't have to be over."

I was all for making this night last longer. "What did you have in mind?"

Opening the partition to speak to the driver, he said, "Take the scenic route." Closing the partition again, he turned to me and said, "I, uh, looked up some, uh, positions that pregnant women can do. That is, if you - "

I cut him off with some tongue kissing of my own.

As we disrobed, I thought, I'm about to lose my virginity in my seventh month.

The positions were certainly interesting, and we snuggled in the afterglow. "Did I say I had a wonderful time before?" I asked. "I didn't even know what the word meant."

"I'm glad you liked it," Kevin said. "How mad would Pop be if - "

Right at that moment, JD kicked, hard enough to jab Kevin in the gut. "Ouch," he giggled.

"I think someone is giving us a hint," I laughed.

Kevin began getting dressed. "Another time, then?"

"Looking forward to it," I said as I kissed him.

I got dressed and combed my hair, so it wouldn't be too obvious what we'd been doing after the last dance. It wasn't until I was in my room that I discovered I'd put my bra and panties on inside out.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The prom.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The next day, Lin came to the house to discuss the film rights for Gaia. "All the major studios want this to their credit," he said while standing on the porch. "I think I've got the deciding factor." He motioned to his side.

An African-American woman stepped into view. "How do you do, Cassie? I'm Ava DuVernay."

I admit, I wasn't as starstruck as I was with Lin, but I was still in awe. "Ms. DuVernay."

"Please," she said, "call me Ava."

"That may take a while, Ava," Lin said. "Her work may be powerful, but she's as down-to-earth as they come."

"I want you to know, Cassie," she said, "I will commit to bringing this play to the screen as close to your vision as can be done. And I won't do any stunt casting. Only the best will be good enough."

"Thank you, Ms. DuVernay. Alright, I'm convinced: Whoever buys the rights must commit to you as director."

"Thanks," she said. "If I may ask, what's your next production?"

"My next production is this," I said, indicating my belly. "The curtain's scheduled to go up June 23rd."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Negotiating the Movie Rights

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The next day, Pat and I went to see Dr. Foster. "I've got bad news for you, Pat," she said. "I'm pulling you out of school."

"What?" she asked. "Why?"

"You're 14 years old," the doctor replied, "and you're carrying twins. Either one puts you at risk of preterm labor. Both together is cause for concern. We want to get you to at least 37 weeks. From now until the babies are born, you're on a strict resting policy: You can walk from your bedroom to the family room, from the family room to the table, from anywhere to the bathroom, or from the family room to the car. Whenever you walk, I want you resting as soon as you get where you're going. And no taking the stairs."

Pat was crushed. "My bedroom is upstairs."

"Not until you're holding those beautiful girls in your arms, it isn't."

Pat sighed. "Well, I wouldn't want to do anything that might hurt my babies. So, if I can't go to school or upstairs, so be it."

"Alright," Dr. Foster said. "From now until your ninth month, I want to see you both every two weeks. See you then."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Seeing Dr. Foster

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"More baby shower gifts?!" I said when I saw the mail. "How many babies do they think we're having?"

"These people don't even know us," Pat added. "How did they know we were having a baby shower?"

"They didn't," Mom said, "but pregnant women generally have baby showers, so I guess your fans figured it was as good a way as any to show their appreciation. And we'll check these packages to make sure they're okay, but, as someone who's been there before, I can assure you that there's no such thing as too many of some baby needs."

In light of Pat's restrictions from Dr. Foster, the Sisterhood decided to have all our baby showers together. Apparently, they were deluged with baby shower gifts, as well. If Mom was right, Gaia had earned us extremely generous fans. From the size of the packages we'd received, it looked like I didn't have to worry about my gifts being duplicated: I got everyone a crib.

******************************


The baby showers went well. Everybody had a great time. The four of us got each other the big gifts, with our friends giving us outfits in multiple sizes (certainly Mom had told us that babies grow fast).

Pop told us that the deliveries were okay, and they proved to be diapers in various sizes.

By a stroke of luck, Mom and Pop had gotten Pat and me diaper bags, so it looked like we were set. Of course, we would probably think of a hundred things we needed once we were taking care of our babies.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Baby Showers

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"Come sit down, Cassie," Mom said. "You need rest more than you need to clean."

For the first time in my life, I responded to those words with a look of incomprehension.

"It's called the nesting instinct," Mom said. "Your stepsister has it, too. And, unlike you, she's under doctor's orders to stay seated. So, for her, if for no other reason, come and sit down."

That got to me, more than talk of rest or nesting instinct. I sat down next to Pat on the couch. As soon as I did, it was like my body cried out in relief. How had I not noticed I was tired?

"I was the same way with you," Mom said. "I wanted to clean the windowsills with a Q-Tip. And, when I didn't feel like scrubbing, I obsessed over the nursery. Did I have absolutely everything? You girls are heading into your last month. It's completely natural to want to be ready for when the babies come. Unfortunately, our brains don't understand half measures. You need to conserve your strength. You'll need every ounce of it in the delivery room, trust me."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The Nesting Instinct

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"Good news, girls," Dr. Foster said to us at our 37-week appointment. "You are now officially full term."

"But I'm not due for three weeks," I said.

"Full term means that your babies are sufficiently developed that, if necessary, they can survive outside the womb," Dr. Foster explained. "You can still carry your baby until he's due, Cassie. Although, that won't be true of you, Pat."

"Why? What's going on?"

"Dilation and effacement is what's going on, Pat. There's a chance you might still be pregnant at 38 weeks, but you definitely will be giving birth before 39 weeks."

"That is good news," Pat said. "I'm ready to have these two already."

We gave the news to Mom on the way to the car, then called Pop to tell him.

When we got home, Pat was even more eagerly awaiting the birth. "I can't wait to stop hurting so much," she said as she got out of the car. "And I swear I've gotten even bigger on the ride home."

As soon as she walked in the door, Pat groaned. "Oh, come on, girls," she said. "I don't make you pee yourselves, why did you make me - "

"Pat," Mom said, "remain calm."

"What? Why?"

"That wasn't your bladder, sweetie. Your water just broke."

"It... it did... ?"

"Where's your bag?"

"Uhhh,... It's the diaper bag in the closet."

"Cassie, call Jimmy. Tell him to meet us at the hospital."

I called Jimmy, who answered on the third ring. "Hello?"

"Jimmy, it's Cassie. Hope you don't have plans for tonight, 'cause Pat just went into labor. Meet us at the hospital."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: 37 Weeks

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Lauren and Jimmy got to the hospital almost as fast as we did, and Pat and Jimmy were taken to a delivery room.

Lauren focused on her phone for a while. "What's up?" I asked.

"Cancelling my classes for the day," she replied.

"Students can just cancel class?" Mom asked.

"No, these are classes I'm giving. At least a dozen musicians want to learn how to play the strand harp, and I'm one of two people who can teach them."

I wanted to congratulate Lauren on her business venture, but I was too worried about Pat. Even when she was a boy, she was considered fragile. Could she handle the strain of childbirth - not once, but twice?

"Pat's stronger than you think, Cassie."

I turned. Pop had spoken as if I had spoken aloud. "Did you read my mind?"

"No. I figured that, if anything had you worried, it had to be Pat."

"And how did you know I was worried?"

"Take a look at your eyes, and see."

I dug out my compact and looked in the mirror. My eyes were glowing blue.

"Clear your thoughts," Pop said, "and your eyes will return to normal."

I closed my eyes. Pop has never led me wrong, I thought. If he says Pat can handle giving birth to twins, then she can do it like a champ.

When I opened my eyes again, they were the same as they were before I became pregnant. "I'm gonna have to get used to that."

******************************


Day turned into night.

Finally, at nearly midnight, Dr. Foster came out. "Twin girls," she said. "Mother and daughters are well and resting comfortably. And Jimmy asked me to tell you that, while he did faint, he came to in time to help Pat with both deliveries."

"Can we see her?"

"Briefly. Don't be shocked by her appearance. She closed her eyes so tightly that she broke some blood vessels. She'll be fine."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Pat Gives Birth to Twins

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
I was the first to enter to see my stepsister. She was pale, but not unhealthily so, with bloodshot eyes due to her holding them closed so tight during the delivery. In her arms were the two most adorable girls I had ever seen. They, too, were slightly pale, with blue Anime like eyes, slightly larger than normal, and a button nose like Pat. I cooed at them before turning to Pat.

"How are you holding up?"

Pat smiled, releasing a sigh. "I'm a half-alien boy, who became a girl, who gave birth to twin girls." In a dreamy voice, she said. "I don't think anything will surprise me anymore."

I giggled at that. "It certainly changed our lives." Smiling, I said. "All in all for the better."

"Where are the others?" Curious, Pat asked.

"Waiting in line for their turn to see you and your angels." Motioning to the curtain, I replied. "The good doctors don't want us to crowd you."

Pat smiled. "Jimmy and I have decided to call them Grace and Faith." Softly, she said.

"It suits them." Smiling back, I said.

"They're keeping me for a few days, to make certain I'm in good health." Sighing, Pat said. "I'm not a fan of hospital food."

I laughed at that. "Very few are."

"Cassie, your time is up." Politely, Mr Smith said. "The others need their time to see the new mother, including your mother and stepfather."

Sighing, I nodded, then turned back to Pat. "I'll be back later."

"See you then." Nodding, Pat said.

I cooed at the twins as they yawned, almost in perfect unison, then left.

The others got their turn to see Pat and her twin babies, before leaving her to rest. The twins were taken to the hospital nursery to be looked after while she recovered. "I hope my baby is just as beautiful." Gently rubbing her baby bump, Brooklynne said.

"Hear, hear." Smiling, Lauren replied.

"This is just the beginning of your adventures, girls." Smiling, Pop said. "Raising children is not as easy as you might think."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The New Mom

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
On the morning of June 16, a week before my due date, I gingerly made my way downstairs, and waddled into the family room, where Mom was putting a cover on Pat. When Pat first came home from the hospital, she carried Grace and Faith into the guest bedroom to nurse. After a few days of that, she got tired of it. Now, when it was time to nurse, she just opened her nursing top and nursing bra, and held Grace and Faith to her breasts like footballs. She did this whether she was alone or not, as two Mormon missionaries and the new deacon over at the Baptist church could attest.

"Mom," I asked, "how can you tell false labor from the real thing?"

Mom stopped what she was doing. "How bad is the pain?"

I was about to reply when it hit. "Goddamn!" I yelled.

"We have a winner," Pat said.

Mom went to get my delivery bag, while Pat got on the phone. "Kevin? Pat. Hope you didn't have plans, 'cause Cassie's in labor. See you there." Then she got the phone tree started to notify the rest of the Sisterhood.

In retrospect, it occurred to me that my language could serve as a barometer for how close I was to delivery. I was yelling "Shit!" by the time Kevin got to the hospital. And, as we went into the delivery room, I was accusing Kevin of practicing incest with his mother, if you know what I mean.

It's amazing how your attitudes change when you're in labor. Going into the delivery room, I was uncomfortable with so many strangers looking at my private parts. By the time I was fully dilated, I didn't even care when I pooped right in front of them.

I confess, I did tell Kevin that I never wanted to have sex with him again. The nurse just told him that she heard that all the time, and none of the mothers had meant it so far.

Finally, after I don't know how many hours, and nearly as many protests from me that I was spent, I felt my baby leave my body, followed shortly by his cry.

"It's a boy," Dr. Foster said, even though we already knew that. She cleaned him up, then brought him to me, to look at and hold for the first time.

He had my hair. He had my ears. But those big, brilliant blue eyes were 100% Gaian.

"So," I said, "you're the one who's been kicking me for months." I kissed his little head. "Welcome to the world, Jonathan Donald Pennant."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Welcome to the World, JD

choices: Mom and Pop come for a visit.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Like Pat, I was told that I would be kept in the hospital for a few days for observation. The food was not as bad as I had feared, just lacking in taste. "I could really go for a home-cooked meal right about now." Sighing, I muttered.

"Then it is a good thing I decided to come visit." Surprising me, Momma Mia said. "I brought you something better than that bland mush they call food." She smiled, showing me a wheeled suitcase she had used for catering. "How is my beautiful niece doing?"

"Niece...?" Surprised, I asked.

Mia nodded. "Who you call Pop is my brother from another mother." she giggled. "Enough of that, though, you need to eat, before we are both caught and get in trouble."

With that, she opened the suitcase to reveal a large helping of beefy baked ravioli, risotto, two biscuits, and a small bottle of sparkling grape juice. "You didn't have to go through all this trouble just for me..." Timidly, I said. "It is appreciated..."

"Then eat." Bemused, Mia said. "I gave Pat the same treatment."

I hungrily but politely ate the meal Mia had brought me, while Mia and I talked. "So your family adopted Pop..." Curious, I said. "How did you first meet?"

"That is a long story, my dear." In a dreamy voice, Mia said. "One I think would be best if Pop told to you." She smiled. "There are certain details that would leave him embarrassed."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, I asked.

Mia blushed slightly. "Well... we found him naked."

I nearly spit out the grape juice I was sipping on. "What?!"

"He was only about four years old when we stumbled upon the crash site of what what we thought was a private jet." Sadly, Mia explained. "Pop was the only one onboard." She sighed, dabbing at a few tears. "We named him Don, after my father. It was not until much later that we learned it was an escape pod."

Pop crashed here. Tearfully, I thought. I wonder what led him to being in that escape pod so long ago.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Recovery

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Shortly after Aunt Mia left, Mom and Pop arrived, followed soon after by a nurse with JD. Mom gave me a cover, and I nursed. Maybe it would be different if I had to deal with twins, but I was way too modest to just whip out my girls in front of my mother and stepfather.

"We saw Mia leaving as we came in," Pop said. "Did she come to see you?"

I nodded. "She brought a care package of some home cooking. Don't tell anyone."

"We won't," Mom promised.

"She... she also told me about how you and she first met."

Pop nodded. "It's not that I never planned to tell you that story, Cassie. It's just, I didn't want to depress you while you were getting ready for this little guy."

I nodded for him to continue.

"We were coming to make our home here," he said. "Only, our ship developed mechanical problems coming out of hyperspace. By the time we reached Earth, it was clear that those of us who could should get into the escape pods while it was still possible." His eyes began to glow. "My parents had been injured, I remember. I think there was some kind of malfunction, and it caused my pod to eject prematurely."

"Not exactly."

We turned. Ms. Switch had come to visit.

"Your parents were hurt worse than they let on to you. They... they wanted to spare you the sight, the memory, of watching them die. So, they put you into the escape pod, and launched it. I know. I was there. I saw it as Kyrl and I got into our own pod."

The four of us mourned for Pop's parents, and for the others who couldn't make it off the ship.

"Now," Ms. Switch said, "let's pull ourselves together - and, the three of us, make our eyes a little less conspicuous - and remember that we're here to celebrate the happiest of occasions."

I still wasn't used to my eyes doing that.

"The reason I came, Cassie," Ms. Switch said, "is to let you know that congratulations and well wishes are flooding social media." She showed me her tablet. A picture of me and JD that Kevin had taken just after I got settled in here had pretty much broken the internet.

"Could you check my Facebook page for me, Mom?"

Mom did as I asked. "Yep. I've never seen so many likes. Oh, there's a message from Mr. Miranda. He wants to know if he can show this to some friends in New York."

"Tell him to go ahead." I checked on JD. "Looks like he's full. Give me a couple minutes, I'll make myself presentable."

As one nurse took JD out, another nurse came in. "If you three could step out," the second nurse said, "Cassie's about to get a roommate."

Mom, Pop, and Ms. Switch said goodbye for now, and my new roommate was brought in. "Nice to see a familiar face."

It was Lauren, along with Mike and her brand-new baby.

"Nice to see you, too. And who is this?"

"This is my daughter, Hope."

I smiled. "Pop will like that."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Mom and Pop come for a visit.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
I was discharged the next day. I had no problem sitting in a wheelchair as a nurse pushed me from my hospital room to the front door. It gave me more time to look at my baby.

As I was getting out of the wheelchair, Sarah and her family were coming to the hospital. "Your time now?" I asked.

She nodded.

"I'm with you in spirit, Sarah."

Physically, though, I had to get going. Mom was going to pick up some stool softener for me, then I could go home.

I was so glad Pop had a stair lift installed. It made getting upstairs so much easier. I put JD into his cosleeper, right next to my bed, and we took a nap.

By the time we woke up, Sarah had given birth to a son, who she and Bill named Matthew.

The next day, it was Dr. Foster's turn to go into labor. She gave birth to a son, who she named Zachary, and a daughter, who she named Michelle.

Grace and Brooklynne weren't due for a month or two, so that got us caught up.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The Babies Keep Coming

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The Sisterhood and our babies had gathered in the family room to watch the Tony Awards. Some of the girls discussed how many awards we'd get, but I didn't care. To me, it really was an honor just to be nominated.

But we did win. We won Best Set Design and Best Costume Design. Sarah got one for Best Supporting Actress, and Lauren got a Tony for her music. "Do you think Lin will get too tired from going up and down those stairs all night?" Brooklynne asked, half joking.

"Okay, girls," Trish said, "now it's Cassie's time to shine."

Fae shushed her. "You'll jinx it!"

If she did, it was a weak jinx, as I won for Best Writing. As he collected my award, Lin said, "I'm sure Cassie would be having the time of her life with us if she were here, but she's at home, holding something a little more precious."

The screen behind him showed the picture of me and JD from Facebook, and it got a standing ovation.

"She didn't name him after me, but that's okay. I'm pretty sure she still thinks my first name is Mister."

That got a few laughs in the theater, and thunderous laughter from our living room. (For the record, I laughed 'til I peed.)

At the end of the night, we had won just about every award we were up for, and I don't want to think about what the delivery man went through to bring our Tonys to us.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The Tony Awards

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The following morning, after both JD and I had breakfast, I turned to Pat, who had just finished nursing Grace and Faith. "Can you help me burp them?" Sighing, she asked. "When one starts crying, the other gets started..."

"Welcome to motherhood." Smiling, Mom said. "I think you two need a little break, so Pop and I are taking you two out to get some air."

I turned to Pop, uncertain, only to see a twinkle of mischief in his eye. "You two need a break from everything for a few hours." Calmly, he said. "I have already arranged for the best baby sitter anywhere in the world."

"Who would that be?" Curious, I asked.

"That would be me, my little Pizano." Kindly, a familiar voice replied.

I turned around to find my grandmother, Rina Pennant, who was short and slightly plump, with shoulder length salt and pepper hair and emerald blue eyes that seemed to sparkle in the light. "Can you handle three babies at once, Grand-mama?" wincing, Pat asked.

"Dear child, I cared for a dozen babies at once." Grinning, Grand-mama replied. "Three will not be a challenge for me."

Pop smiled as he opened the door. "Shall we..."

Pat and I turned to each other before shrugging. "I guess..." Wincing, I said.

I really did not want to be away from JD for any amount of time, but I did need a little break from everything that had happened in the past several months. Pat and I kissed our babies goodbye for the moment, then reluctantly followed Mom and Pop out the door to the car. "Don't you worry, my little pizanos." Grand-mama said. "Your babies are safe with me."

"Your grandmother has skills that would surprise you." Smiling, Pop said. "She had to adapt fast to raise a Gaian child."

Pat and I got into the car, while Pop took the wheel and Mom sat in the front passenger seat. "Where are we going?" curious, I asked.

"Just around..." Smiling, Mom said.

Again, Pat and I turned to each other, only this time, we giggled. "You two have something planned, don't you?" Smiling, Pat asked.

Mom merely smiled as the car pulled away from the house and we drove into town. Before we knew it, we were driving out of town, onto the freeway, until we saw a familiar blinking sign, "The Stardust Hotel... where it all began." Softly, I said.

"This was not our idea, kids." Smiling, dad said. "Mister Lin-Manuel Miranda and Nathan Creed put this all together."

"The new CEO of Grimm Oil?" Surprised, I asked.

Pop grinned. "It has been renamed to Creed Energy." Calmly, he said. "That invention the Sisterhood showed him made history yesterday."

"It did...?!" Surprised, Pat asked.

Mom nodded before giggling. "Los Angeles is no longer the smoggiest city in the US." Smiling, she said. "It now has the cleanest air anyone has seen in over two hundred years."

Upon arriving at the Stardust Hotel, we were greeted by the Sisterhood. "Any idea why we are here, Cassie?" Curious, Brooklynne asked.

I smiled. "I have an idea..."

Before I was asked to explain, Mom and Pop ushered us all inside the main lobby, where we were greeted by a thunderous "SURPRISE!!"

We all jumped but smiled as we saw Lin, Mr. Creed, and our parents cheering us. "Today is a day for celebration in more ways than one." Smiling, Mr. Creed said. "We are one step closer to healing our planet, thanks you all of you."

"That, and we wanted to deliver your awards to you in style." Grinning, Lin said.

"It is not too late to save the garden of Eden." Serious, Mr. White said. "God... The Gods... or whichever deity you choose to believe, has given us a second chance to see the Light."

"Aye." Nodding, Mr. Stewart said. "We are all truly blessed, so let the party begin!"
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Surprise Party

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Sparkling grape juice was brought to everyone in wine glasses before Pop raised his hand, gaining everyone's attention. "First, and foremost, a toast to my daughter, on her seventeenth birthday!"

"Happy Birthday, Cassie!" Cheering, everyone said.

I blushed at that as presents were brought my way, from everyone, including members of the Sisterhood. I turned to Pat, who shrugged. "Pop told me to put my present to you in the trunk last night for a surprise birthday party." Softly, she explained. "I didn't expect this, though."

"We were all duped." Ruefully, Sarah said. "My father told me the surprise party was going to be on holy ground."

Mr. White smiled. "To the Gaians, this is holy ground." Calmly, he explained. "This is where their dying world was given its second chance, through the three virgin mothers and the transformed boy of their religion."

Lauren, Sarah, and I blushed, knowing we were those virgin mothers. Pat blushed as well, knowing she was the transformed boy, though she gave Mr. White a confused look, who merely shrugged before Mrs. White spoke. "He and I had a long talk with Sarah, learning all about the Gaian religion." Kindly, she said. "It would be a sin to allow the religion of an entire world to just die off and be forgotten."

We all smiled at that, as Mr White spoke again. "All that matters is the belief in a God and that, through Him, all fears and obstacles can be conquered." He then smiled. "Now that I had my chance to give my sermon, let us celebrate the many victories of the Sisterhood!"

Everyone cheered, and the party went into full gear, starting with my presents from everyone. Lin gave me a copy of our play, Gaia, on DVD, along with my Tonys. "These DVDs are selling like hotcakes." smiling, he said. "I have a strong feeling the movie is going to break the internet."

I giggled at that, as Pat gave me her present to me. It was a small globe of Gaia. "Dr Foster and Ms Switch helped me piece it together." blushing, she said. "It almost feels like home."

I teared up, looking at the globe of seven great continents and six great seas. "It does feel like home, in a way." Softly, I said.

From Mom and Pop, I got a journal with the words, 'From Gaia and back again' written in gold on the cover. "It has our legacy written in the first several pages." Tearing up, Pop said. "It is now up to you to fill in the rest."

I gave both Mom and Pop a hug, with tears of joy. "I'll write in it every day." Smiling, I promised.

One present after the other was opened and appreciated. Every member of the Sisterhood was given their Tony, which we all decided to donate to the Stardust Hotel, to show guest that it was from there it all began. "My business has boomed since Gaia hit the Playhouse Square." Blushing, Mr. Stewart said. "This will bring even more guests."

"I guess we will have to expand sooner than we thought." Smiling, Mrs. Stewart said.

Kevin chuckled. "I know what I'll be doing this summer."

"Nonsense!" Serious, Mr. Stewart said. "Your place is at your lover's side." He smiled seeing both Kevin and me blush. "Besides, we already have it covered."

"I don't suppose the Sisterhood has any ideas to fix our rivers, lakes, and oceans..." Hopeful, Mr. Creed said. "Just asking..."

Lauren and I shared a grin. "As a matter of fact, we do..."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The party.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
After the party had ended, around nine in the evening, Mr. Creed talked to Lauren and me about the latest blueprints we had offered him. "These are absolutely revolutionary." Excited, Creed said. "Who would have imagined magnetizing plastic?!"

"It's a simple process, actually." Calmly, Lauren explained. "A plastic magnet is a non-metallic magnet made from an organic polymer. When combined with the free radical-forming TCNQ as an acceptor molecule, it can mimic the mechanism of metallic magnets."

Creed shook his head. "You... lost me." Blushing, he said.

"It's a new type of plastic that attracts other plastics." Simply, I said. "By changing the formula a bit, as explained in the blueprints, you can attract glass, oil, paper..."

"Incredible..." Smiling, Creed said. "With this technology, we can clean out all of our streams, rivers, and oceans in a fraction of the time." He turned to us as if he were looking at a rare, lost treasure. "You kids are prodigies, well beyond your years. You are going to go far, all of you."

"Thank you." Smiling, I said.

"What's next for you kids?" Curious, Mr. Stewart asked. "World peace?"

Pop chuckled at that. "I think the Sisterhood would like a vacation after all of this." Smiling, he said. "After all, I think they've earned it."

Creed smiled. "I think I can help arrange that."

"So can I." Smiling as well, Mr. Dietrich added.

As the other parents added their support, I turned to my friends, smiling as well... "Where did you have in mind?" Curious, I asked.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: After the party.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
First of all, if you were on the flight with us, we apologize. If it makes you feel any better, we missed out on just as much sleep as you did. Maybe someday, somebody will develop a more baby-friendly method of intercontinental travel.

Our first stop was Paris. Paris was every bit as beautiful as I'd heard. Remember when I said I didn't know anything about the Eiffel Tower? Well, I do now, and it's this: You have to see it in person to really appreciate it.

One thing we definitely appreciated was the attitude towards public breastfeeding. Back home, covering up was expected. In Paris, women feeding their babies was just something that happened.

But let me tell you about something important that happened in Paris:

******************************


We were sitting at a cafe, enjoying the food and the sights in equal measure. Somewhere along the line, I noticed a group of girls looking at us and talking among themselves. "What do you suppose they're talking about?" I asked.

"Maybe they're starstruck," Mom suggested. "Remember, Gaia was streamed over the internet."

Eventually, one of them approached me. "Pardon me," she said. "You are the girls who made Gaia, oui?"

It looked like Mom's theory of an international fan base was correct. "Yes, we are."

I expected her to ask for my autograph, or maybe a selfie. Instead, she embraced me, and said, "It is true, you know."

That last part surprised me enough for me to say, "I know. My son is proof."

With that, she turned her attention to JD. "He is so beautiful," she said. "I hope my baby will look like him."

"Your baby?"

She nodded, and motioned to her friends. "We are all having Gaian babies."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: European vacation.

choices: We are noticed by the Paparazzi.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
I smiled, noticing all the girls had blue eyes, wearing western style clothing, before introducing myself and the others. "How far along are you?"

"We are all about four months in, give or take." Smiling, the first girl said. "I'm Marie Delacour. Yes, I heard all the jokes... this is my brother, now sister, Josette."

Marie and Josette both had long auburn hair. Marie was tall and well-built, while her sister was very short and frail. We all turned to Josette, who gave a shy wave and turned to Pat. "Were you... a boy before this, like me?" Softly, she asked.

Pat blushed before nodding. "You, too...?"

Josette nodded back. "I was halfway through transition when it happened." Blushing, she explained. "I guess the strange hotel workers thought I was close enough."

"Hotel workers?" Surprised, Lauren asked.

The third girl nodded. She was short and slightly plump, with short black hair. "I'm Rose Rossi. We had all ended up at the same hotel, the Star Gazer, for different reasons, and had to spend the night." Serious, she said. "Josette was the one who made the connection between our mysterious pregnancies and a strange blue light that had flown through all of our rooms while we slept."

"Pat made that same connection." Calmly, Mom said. "Did you all search yourselves for a tracking device?"

Rose gulped. "Tracking... device...?" startled, she asked.

I sighed. "Please turn around." Softly, I said.

Uncertain, Rose turned around, and I checked the base of her skull. Sure enough, there was something that looked like a mole in the exact same spot. I gently ripped it off and showed her the tiny transmitting device. "This was how they were tracking us, and how they are now tracking you too."

The other girls turned pale, raising their hands to their necks as if they had just learned they had cancer. Mom helped them, one at a time, to remove the devices and dropped them into a nearby drain, sending them far away. "They should come to you now." Serious, she said. "There, you can confront them, and get the answers you need."

The fourth girl sighed. She was of average height with long blond hair. "The aliens... already came to us." Softly, she said. "I'm Christina Romano, by the way. My friends call me Chris." She shook her head. "Why would they... tag us?"

"It was to ensure their plan did not fail." Softly, Pop explained. "I can assure you that move was highly controversial, and heavily protested."

The fifth girl turned to Pop, curious. She was tall and well-built, with shoulder-length brown hair. "I'm Lena Russo... the aliens told you this?" Softly, she demanded. "The aliens who came to us said that their planet was dying, and that they had a desperate plan to save their race..."

Pop allowed his eyes to glow blue before changing back to their natural color, stunning the other group of girls. "I came here as a child when the plan was first being put together." Serious, he explained. "I only learned of this after reviewing parchments that were recovered from my escape pod." He teared up. "I was one of the only survivors out of a hundred Gaians, in a desperate journey to fly to Earth."

Maria and her friends teared up, hearing that, before Josette suddenly lit up as if inspiration had struck her. "Maybe we can make a play out of that." Serious, she suggested. "Honor the Gaians who gave their lives, so that their desperate plan could be put into motion."

"That is truly inspiring, Josette." Impressed, Maria said. "We could call it Gaia Deux."

Pop teared up more. "I would be honored..."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The European Sisterhood

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"I'll draw something up," I said, "so you have the legal right to create a sequel."

Pat stuck close by Josette. "You said you were transitioning when the Gaians chose you?"

"Oui," she replied. "I realized I am a girl when I was very young. The Gaians gradually changed me so I am fully female. Was it the same for you?"

"No. I was as cis as they come. But I was small and thin, and I wore my hair long. So, like a lot of people, the Gaians assumed I was a girl. The pregnancy would have killed all three of us if they hadn't changed me. It killed the three of them in the process."

Just then, three adults in business attire entered the cafe and made a beeline for us. "Is everything alright here, mademoiselle?" one of the men said. Funny thing, even though he spoke French, and I was usually lost without my phrasebook, I understood him perfectly.

"All is well here," Pop said, letting his eyes glow so they knew he was Gaian. "Like their American counterparts in the Sisterhood, these girls do not require monitoring. You may observe them if you wish, but you have no need to know where they are at all times."

"What means 'Sisterhood'?" Marie asked.

"When we found out that we all were pregnant under the same circumstances," I explained, "one of our mothers called us the Sisterhood of the Maternity Pants. It's a reference to a series of American novels aimed at teenage girls. The Sisterhood part stuck. By the way, how did your friends take the news that they were seeded?"

"What?" asked the European Sisterhood, in one voice.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: European Gaians arrive.

choices: Pop and Oceane make an illusion.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"It's true." Blushing, Darla said. "When I decide to have a child of my own, it will have Gaian blood coursing through his or her veins."

The European Sisterhood turned to each other, their mouths half open in shock, before they turned to the three adults, their eyes demanding an explanation.

"Americans..." Shaking her head, one Gaian woman muttered. "We were hoping to bring the children into the loop slowly, so as not to overwhelm them."

"Thanks to the Brave Voyagers, we now have all the time in the world." Smiling, the second man said. He then turned to us. "By the way, which of you drew up the blueprints for the A.A.P.S. and rubbish magnet?"

Lauren and I raised our hands. "We sort of drew them up together." Kindly, I said.

The man bowed. "Merci, mademoiselle."

"Thanks to your, err, Sisterhood, Earth is well on its way to also having all the time in the world." Calmly, the first man said. He sighed. "If only they could learn to get along..."

I sighed. "We would love to help, but... it's an overwhelming task."

The Gaian woman giggled. "You and your friends just helped an entire species come back from the brink of extinction." Ruefully, she said.

I giggled at that. "I suppose..."

The Gaian smiled. "Ah, but where are our manners? I am Oceane Shepherd, and this is Lionel Armand to my right, and Quincy Bacot to my left."

I nodded to each of them before introducing myself and the others.

Marie said, "We were considering the possibility of making a musical of our own, talking about the brave voyagers who found the path to Earth."

"That is a wonderful idea." Smiling, Oceane said. "I still remember the song that was sung to commemorate their historic launch to find the ancient Mayan path."

"Mayan path..." Stunned, Pat whispered. "So they were from..."
