Lionel nodded. "They left Gaia centuries ago to build a new life elsewhere in hopes of finding a more peaceful life."

"So your ship was racing to Earth to show the others the way." Tearing up, I said.

Pop nodded then softly began to sing with the rest of us soon joining in...

Following the path of the Mayan
We launch into the void
To save all Gaians
Brave Voyagers!

Desperate for a rebirth
We race for a planet called Earth
Grieving for all our loss
Who knows what dangers we will cross

We must steel our heart and nerve
Our people we have to preserve
If we lose the path the elders decrypt
The Gaian race will be extinct!

Struggling with the unknown
We won't stop till we reach our new home
Send a signal when we arrive
The Gaian race with thrive with Brave Voyagers!

Being in an outdoor cafe, our singing attracted a crowd, who applauded once we were done singing, with shouts of "Bravo! Brava!" and "Encore!"

Through blushing, we and the European Sisterhood took a quick bow, before we caught several flashes going off. Rose looked about and saw a number of people with cameras pushing their way through he crowd. A sigh escaped her lips. "Paparazzi..."

"Should we try to lose them?" Wincing, I asked.

Pop turned to Oceane before the two shared a smile...
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Continue

choices: The tale of the Brave Voyagers.
Word of Gaia Deux hits the news.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
At first, I did not know what Pop or Oceane were planning. Then, I saw an empty tour bus nearby, and let out a low giggle. "Yours....?" Whispering, I asked.

Marie nodded, then turned to her friends, who all got the idea. I turned to Pat and our friends, and they also got the idea. Another camera flash caught our eye, and Oceane stood up with Pop, raising their hands, signaling for silence. The crowd hushed themselves, and Pop spoke. "Good people of Paris, the second chapter of Gaia is being produced and performed by your own young talented teenagers, led by Marie Delacour!"

The crowd cheered and more camera flashes filled the scene as Oceane spoke. "It will be bigger and better than the original, with the cast of the first chapter helping us bring it all to the stage, led by Cassie Pennant!"

Again, the crowd cheered and congratulated us all, giving words of encouragement as we all moved through the crowd towards the tour bus. The Paparazzi tried to get in closer, but the crowd of spectators was too dense for them to get through, and we easily made it to the tour bus before they could even get close. We drove off, waving and smiling at the crowd, before reeling over our all too easy escape from the Paparazzi. "How did you know that would work?" Curious, I asked.

Pop grinned. "You'd be surprised how one can work a crowd to his favor." Calmly, he said.

"So what now...?" Worried, Josette asked. "We don't have any songs, or dialog, or..."

She stopped, seeing Lauren and me grinning. "We have the songs, and Pop here was on the ship that paved the way home to Earth." Calmly, I said.

"I was on that ship, too." Smiling, Ms Switch said. "We have all of the songs, dialog, and ideas for props and musical instruments."

"I know Gaian history." Softly, Marie said. "Only I'm really into philosophy."

"I'm into history, only I know all about Gaian philosophy." Wincing, Josette said.

"It is so you will teach each other." Smiling, i said. "I'm into gadget making, like Pop, but my head is filled with songs and artwork."

"I'm into songs and artwork, but my head is filled with gadgetry and inventions, so we help each other piece things together, using what we both love."

"My head is filled with animals and insects of Gaia." With a shudder, Rose said. "Only my love is really Astrology and Tarot card reading."

"I love animals and insects, but my head is filled with Astrology and Tarot card reading." Calmly, Lena said. "Maybe we can work together and use some of what we love in the next musical."

"I don't see why not." Smiling, I said. "We have been getting a lot of questions about Gaia since our play streamed world wide."

"What about you, Chris?" Curious, Pat asked. "What fills your head?"

Chris teared up. "Nothing...." Pouting, she said. "Just strange sounds that I can't explain..."

Ms Switch smiled. "You mean sounds like this..."

She began to make beautiful yet haunting sounds that almost resembled singing, but it was unlike any song we had ever heard. Chris's eyes widened in shock as she slowly nodded. "What are those sounds...?"

Mrs Switch teared up, smiling brightly. "My dear, Chris, you had been blessed with the songs of the ancient Gaians." Softly, she explained. "Earth folk would call them... Indians, Aborigine, Dogon, and so on." She wiped at her tears. "I am among the last of those lost people, and I am blessed and honored that you are carrying on our legacy."

Chris began to cry. "I will not let you down, Ms Switch." Serious, she said.

Ms Switch gave Chris a warm hug. "I know you won't..."

"So... where do we start?" Curious, Josette asked.

Pop smiled. "By telling you the tale..."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Losing the Paparazzi.

choices: Word of Gaia Deux hits the news.
The making of a new musical.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Later on, we all met at Marie and Josette's house, where we were all served tea and crumpets before settling down to talk. Our hosts, Manon Delacour and his wife, Sylvie. greeted us with a smile as introductions were made. "Welcome to our humble home." Politely, Manon said. "We grow grapes for wine here."

"We are very curious to know the story of how the Gaians found Earth, so to save their dying race." Kindly, Sylvie added. "Please... Pop, tell us what you know."

"I only know what I do from the captain's logs, as I was very young when we took the journey." Calmly, Pop explained. "Our scholars had determined that the ancient Gaians knew the only way to preserve their way of life was to branch out to other planets."

"Most of their records had been destroyed over time, due to age, war, or arrogance." Sadly, Ms Switch added. "We know that they had fled to several other planets, but the only record that had survived the test of time were tales of Earth."

"Tales of Earth...?" Curious, Josette asked.

Pop nodded. "The ancient texts described Earth as a place to hide." Serious, he said. "A world filed with a hostile populous still struggling with their own inner demons."

"'Here there be tigers,'" Softly, Pat said. "It was what sailors had said when they had found a hostile place,... a cryptic warning to avoid going there."

"At first, we were hesitant to go to Earth." Sadly, Ms Switch said. "The path to take us there was not clear, but the warning of its hostile inhabitants were." She sighed. "Still, we were no better in our own past, so there was hope."

"Our scholars pieced together what was left of the ancient texts to lay out the most likely course, but warned us that there were no guarantees." Calmly, Pop said. "The Mayans may not have made it to Earth, and, if they had, they may not have survived long."

Ms Switch nodded. "We left Gaia on faith alone, to pave the way to salvation. The journey was treacherous and long." She sighed. "We had taken almost half of what was left of the fertile soil in our remaining living valley, so as to grow our own food for the journey."

"We had been out six months, traveling at ten times the speed of light, and still no sign or signal of Earth from what the ancient texts told us to look for." Sadly, Pop said. "We were all beginning to lose hope..."

"Then, a young Earth girl sent out a simple message." Smiling, Mom said. "'Hello from planet Earth... Is anyone out there?'"

"Everyone cried and cheered, hearing that beautiful, wonderful voice from a small child." Tears flowing, Ms Switch said. "We followed the signal, and found a wormhole that led us straight to the glorious blue planet of Earth."

"How did you know about the signal from a little girl, Mom?" Curious, I asked. "Had Pop told you the story before?"

Pop smiled. "Cassie, your mother was that little girl who sent the message."

My jaw dropped as Pop began to sing, with the other Gaians joining in...

We have left our home
Into the dark unknown
We're praying for a sign
'Cause we're lost and alone
It's not over... Till it's over.

Now we're fighting our fear
To save those we hold dear
Praying our final destination is near
But we are lost...
The path is lost...

How we wish we were there
To bring hope to all our tears
Find the path... some how...

Then our souls catch on fire!
A cry in the dark!
We know what to aim for
A child's cry lifted our hearts!

We go full full power ahead
Our fate in our hands
We found Earth, our mark
Thanks to a cry in the dark!

"You can imagine my shock when I learned of this." Tearfully, Ms Switch said. "The mission to save our entire world, our entire species, was successful, due to your mother sending out a cry in the dark."

"We did not reveal this to her until we knew for certain that you and your friends were targeted for the desperate plan to rebuild the Gaian race." Softly, Pop said. "Truth be told, I had forgotten most of it over time..."

"You were just a child when we found the path to Earth, Pop." Comforting him, Ms Switch said.

"Wait a minute,..." Confused, I said. "If mom was the child who sent the signal, and Pop was so young when he came here,... "

Mom nodded. "I am of Mayan descent." Calmly, she said. "Which means I age just as slowly as Pop, because, in a way, I am a Gaian, too."

I smiled at that.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The tale of the Brave Voyagers.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Back at the hotel, we were watching CNN, to find out how things were going back home, when the entertainment reporter broke the story: "From Paris comes word that a follow-up to Gaia, the stage smash that swept the Tonys, is being produced. Called Gaia Deux, reports say that it will focus on the Gaians who traveled to Earth. Cassie Pennant, the high school student who stunned the Great White Way, is producing the play. A film version of the original Gaia is now in production, helmed by Ava DuVernay."

"That certainly didn't take long," Pop said.

"I'm just worried about how it will be received," I said. "The original was about environmental devastation, and it resonated with people. Will the story of the Gaians coming to Earth have the same impact?"

"Don't sell your people short, Cassie," Pop replied. "The story of people making new lives in an unfamiliar place has more resonance than you anticipate. The story of a foundling raised by natives is in both religion and comic books, after all."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Word of Gaia Deux hits the news.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The next day, I broached my concerns with the Sisterhood.

"It's far more than just moving to unknown lands through unfamiliar waters." Serious, Quincy said. "It's bringing the knowledge of how to save those lands from the same mistakes we had made in our past."

"It's also the heavy burden of responsibility, and the high honor of saving not one species, but two, from complete extinction." Tearfully, Lionel added. "We came here to a world on the brink of the point of no return. It is not too late,... not yet."

Marie and I stood up, as if inspired by their words. "Then we must make Gaia Deux about a return to nature." Serious, I said. "The path of the Maya."

"A play showing how we can pull back from the brink and return the Earth to its original splendor." smiling, Marie added. "Oceane did tell us that they wept, seeing the destruction we were doing to our planet, as it reminded her to the era no one listened."

"We called it the deaf ear and blind eye era." Sadly, Oceane said. "The time those in power refused to listen to reason, when the signs were obvious that our planet was falling down a path that would make it uninhabitable to us." She shed a few tears as a smile touched the corners of her mouth. "Fortunately, here on Earth, there are nations who are actually starting to listen."

"Then Gaia Deux needs to be heard loud and clear." Standing up Pat said.

"Hear hear!" Standing as well, Josette declared.

"New songs, with new instruments, and new costumes that merge Gaia and Earth fashions!" Rising to her feet, Lauren shouted. "I say we get to work straightaway!"

"Um... did you bring any animals or insects from Gaia with you?" Worried, Lena asked. "With the planet dying, wouldn't they be facing extinction, too?"

"That is a good point, Lena." Smiling, Ms Switch said. "There was one ship that carried animals, one male and one female, to another planet, but mankind will not discover them for centuries."

"I... don't understand." Wincing, I said.

Oceane sighed. "There was an alternate plan, in case Earth was not savable." Softly, she said. "However, we only had one shot, and, fortunately, it worked."

"What...?" Curious, Lena asked.

"We terraformed Venus into a livable planet, and left the animals there to live without our influence." Softly, Quincy explained. "We owed it to them..."

"As far as anyone on Earth is concerned, Venus is an uninhabitable planet." Serious, Oceane said. "Humankind is not ready to know it is a new 'Garden of Eden'."

"The secret is safe with us." Firmly, I said.

The others nodded, giving their promise to keep the secret, before I heard something between a meow and a coo. I turned and cooed myself upon seeing a kitten with actual wings! Seeing what I was looking at, Oceane giggled. "How did you get out of your carrier, Manta?" Lightly scolding, she demanded. She patted her lap. "Come on, up..."

The kitten spread its wings and flew up onto Oceane's lap. "Ancient humans would call this a Manticore kitten." Smiling, she said. "Please note the stinger on the tip of her tail."

I gulped taking notice of it. "I'm glad I didn't try to pet it..." Wincing, I said.

Oceane laughed. "It's not poisonous, or even sharp." Bemused, she explained. "The stinger is primarily used to intimidate would-be predators, and attract a mate. Other than that, she's just your ordinary house cat."

I cautiously began to pet Manta, then giggled as she began to purr.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The New Play Takes Shape

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
We gathered at a cafe for lunch. Most passersby seemed to take little notice of us, except to tell us how beautiful our babies were (Just a moment, let me check - no, that hasn't gotten old yet). One person did take interest in us, or at least some of us. She was a blonde teen in expensive clothes. She spoke to Marie, and, while I was far from fluent in French, her tone spoke of condescension.

Marie sighed. "Serafine, this is Cassie Pennant. Cassie, this is Serafine Manon."

"Pleased to meet you," I said, offering my free hand.

Serafine responded with an entire sentence in French.

"I think we both need a translator," I said to Marie.

"Serafine is fluent in English," Marie replied. "The only people she despises more than she does me are Americans."

"Well, I envy you your fluency in more than one language," I said, "but I've dealt with snobs before, and they tend to get shown up. Superiority is a childish notion, one I hope to raise my son without."

Serafine responded in a way that required no translation: she flipped me the bird and left.

Once Serafine was gone, Marie asked, "You've dealt with someone like her? How did you do it?"

"You'll probably need a different strategy," I replied. "Brooklynne reformed after we found out that she was seriously messed up, as a result of sexual assault by her cousin. Now she's back home, awaiting a Gaian child of her own."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Meeting Marie's rival.

choices: Marie's school is interested in the play.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"What's her story, anyway?" Curious, I asked.

Marie sighed. "Serafine was the best at everything, or so she thought." Calmly, Marie explained. "Shortly after we were impregnated by the Gaians, my friends and I began to excel at literally everything." She winced. "I did not try to, it just happened, and, well,..."

"You all passed Serafine up in every category." Sighing myself, I said.

Marie nodded. "Socially, academically, physically,..." she shook her head. "Did that happen to you and your friends?"

"I know our grades soared shortly after we learned we were pregnant." Calmly, I replied. "I guess you could say we excelled socially as well, with the play and all."

"Serafine has hated me ever since my friends and I began to break all of her records." Sadly, Marie said. "At least we all graduated this year."

This surprised me. "You graduated?"

Marie nodded. "Summer vacations are only three weeks long in Europe, so we all graduate earlier than in the States." Serious, she explained. "Josette took advanced college classes, and got moved up into my class, just in time to graduate with us."

I chuckled. "I sort of envy you there."

Marie shook her head. "In a way, I envy you." Calmly, she said. "Now that I'm out of school, I have to go to college or find a job." She sighed. "At least we have the vineyard."

"You don't think you can get into college or find a job?" surprised, I asked.

"It's a bit hard to focus on that, with a child on the way." Worried, Marie said.

I smiled and touched her shoulder. "We will help you."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Serafine and Marie's rivalry.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Marie and I, along with the Sisterhood and our parents, helped Marie and her Sisterhood with first-time-mother jitters. We shared stories of our challenges and triumphs, our cheers and tears, through our own adventures of carrying a child up to birth. It did not take long for Marie to feel more confident. "Every first-time mother goes through it, Marie." Calmly, Mom explained. "It's natural to feel the way you do."

"Just wait until you discover your child's gender."

I giggled at that. "With Gaian pregnancy, a mother's overall emotions during a certain trimester determine the gender of the child. Also, if she's fine with people touching her belly, it means she's having only one. But, if she's skittish about who touches her, she's having twinsies."

At this, the European Sisterhood turned and laughed at Lena, who blushed.

Marie smile at that. "Well, at least I'll have more time to think of a name."

"And," Lena added, "once I narrow it down to two names, I'm all set."

We all giggled at that, but paused as a short, plump woman approached us. Marie seemed to recognize her right away, and stood up to greet her. "Ms Rugby, good to see you again!" Hugging her, she said. "I'd like you to meet the Sisterhood from the States. They wrote and performed the hit play, Gaia."

"An honor," Smiling, Ms Rugby said. "Your play has sparked a new momentum to save the planet."

"Just doing our small part." Blushing, I said.

Ms Rugby smiled. "I came to ask how far along Gaia Deux is from the stage."

"We're just getting started, actually." Wincing, Marie replied.

"We need time to make the costumes, build the props, and polish the songs." Calmly, Ms Switch said. "That, and rehearsals..."

"If I may be so bold, Pangaea Academy has an excellent drama club, with all the material and room needed to piece your play together." Softly, Ms Rugby said. "If I recall, Gaia was produced in a high school as well."

"Pangaea Academy does have everything we need." Thoughtfully, Josette said. "That, and it is summer vacation, so the school will be empty. We should be able to piece the play together without interruption."

Everyone nodded, giving their approval, and I turned to Ms Rugby. "I guess we accept your offer, then."

Ms Rugby smiled. "I'll let the school board know of your decision." Happy, she said. "We will see you there tomorrow."

"Um... So how long is our vacation going to be?" curious, I asked.

Pop smiled. "Relax, I have already arranged for you to take online courses to finish the year, due to your newfound fame." Calmly, he said. "We can stay in Europe for as long as it takes to help them complete their play."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Marie's school is interested in the play.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Pangaea Academy, it turned out, was a boarding school. It once had catered to the rich and socially elite. However, exceptionally talented students had been allowed to attend, due to their potential to go far in the world. Marie and her sisterhood were among them. Everything about the school, from its tall stone walls to heavy gates and modern buildings, screamed 'members only'.

"Please do not judge us too harshly." Wincing, Ms Rugby said. "We really aren't that much different from an ordinary high school."

"Another reason Serafine does not like us." Whispering, Marie said. "We were not exactly considered wealthy until... all this happened."

I nodded. "I know the feeling, though we do not see wealth as most do." Whispering back, I said. "In the big picture, it's not worth all that much."

"So, you are producing the play here, are you, Marie?" Startling us, a tall, slender girl said with ice in her voice. "I guess success does open many doors."

"Maribel, I expect better manners from you." Sternly, Ms Rugby scolded. "With a high status comes high expectations, including humility."

"We could have chosen La Plaine Saint-Denis." Calmly, Marie retorted. "However, we decided on a humble beginning, as did our American friends."

Maribel scoffed, then walked off, causing Ms Rugby to sigh. "I'm sorry about her." Softly, she said. "She has lived her life getting exactly what she wants, but now she is finding that the real world does not work that way."

"We have a friend like that." Smiling, I said. "She turned out to be real nice..." I paused, hearing my cellphone ring. "Speak of the devil... Hey, Brooklynne...."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Pangaea Academy.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"How are you, girlfriend?" Brooklynne asked. "Nicole's a brand-new mommy."

"She is?" I asked. "Tell me more."

"It's a girl. 8 pounds, 5 ounces. She's named her Diane."

I relayed the news to the others, who cheered. Back to Brooklynne, I asked, "How are you? Your due date must be getting close."

"Ugh, not close enough. I swear, one day, I'm going to have no pain, and I'm not going to figure out what I'm supposed to do."

"Bad?"

"My back is killing me, and now my belly's started hurting. Must be jealous."

"Uh, Brooklynne,... "

"And now the baby's gone and made me wet myself," she cried. "See if I give you a Mercedes for your 16th birthday, you little... "

"Brooklynne, you're not alone, are you?"

"No, the girls are with me."

"Ask one of them to check you out. That might not be pee."

"What do you mean, it might not - " she began. Then, she asked someone else, "What do you mean, it isn't pee?"

"Brooklynne, you'd better call Dr. Foster. I'm pretty sure your water just broke."

I was then treated to an extended remix of "Ohmygodohmygodohmygod."

"Brooklynne," I said, "I'm going to let you go, so you can call Dr. Foster. I'll talk to you later. Goodbye."

After I hung up, I told the others, "Brooklynne's in labor."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: News from the States.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The phone woke me up in the middle of the night. "Who would be calling at this ridiculous hour?" I asked nobody in particular. Then I checked the caller ID, and remembered that there was a huge time difference between Paris and the States. "Hello?"

"Hi," Brooklynne said, in a tone of voice I hadn't heard since a pure Gaian child was implanted in her. "I'm a mom."

"I figured. There's usually more."

"A boy. A beautiful little boy. His name's Donald."

Pop's name. "Any particular reason?"

"I was destroying myself, and nobody would have blamed you and Pat if you let me do it. But you saved me. You saved my life, my mind, and my soul. I want my son to be just like the man who raised you. I love you guys. I love you so much."

"We love you, too, Brooklynne."

"Can I talk to the others?"

"Let's wait on that, okay, Brooklynne? You should spend some time with your son. Besides, there's a bit of a time difference."

"Oh, gosh . Sorry I woke you."

"It's okay, I understand." JD began fussing. "Besides, I think Mom's Restaurant just opened for business."

"Okay. Let's both take care of our babies."

I hung up, opened my nursing gown, and brought JD to my breast. "You've got a cousin," I told him. "Once we're back home, you can say hi. Sound like fun?"

Honestly, I have no idea how much he understands. Sometimes, I look into those big blue eyes, and I swear he knows the secrets of the universe. And then, sometimes, I ask myself, where do cosmic awareness and poopy diapers meet on a Venn diagram?
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Brooklynne's Baby

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Two days had passed since we were invited to work at Pangaea Academy. I must say, it was a lot less expensive than staying at a five star hotel. That, and the school security staff did a marvelous job at keeping the paparazzi at bay. Still, news of Gaia Deux being produced at Pangaea Academy brought them a record number of applications for the following year. "Popularity always bring a crowd." Bemused, Pop said. "Fortunately, we have plenty of songs for this part of the story."

"Indeed we do." Smiling, Ms Switch said. "With some luck, these songs will touch the hearts of every nation."

"Who do we have first for the auditions?" curious, I asked.

Marie looked at the clipboard she was holding and sighed. "Serafine."

Ms Switch nodded. "Serafine, you are up to sing 'We Can Be Heroes'."

Serafine stepped up, holding a defiant look on her face, which annoyed both Marie and me, only I noticed that both Pop and Ms Switch raised an eyebrow. Only, to our surprise, her eyes briefly glowed a bright blue, before returning to their normal color as she muttered, "I have to be the best... I have to be the best..." under her breath. I knew Pop had seen this, too, as he raised his hand, calling for her attention.

"Hold on a moment, young lady." Firmly but kindly, he said. "Ms Rugby and I will have a brief word with you."

Serafine opened her mouth to speak, but she stopped, her eyes growing wide, as Pop whispered something to her. She began to tremble as Pop calmly led her out of earshot with Ms Rugby. I could not hear what was being said but, knowing Pop, it was something close to a sermon. Within seconds, Serafine was crying into her hands, and Pop gently pulled her into a hug, slowly rocking her. "What did he say to her?" Worried, Marie asked. "I mean, I know we are rivals, but..."

"He told her the truth." Softly, Ms Switch said. "It seems that Serafine is your rival for a reason other than jealousy."

Pop brought a trembling Serafine and stunned Ms Rugby back to the group. "Marie, your rival, Serafine, was the victim of a hate crime." Firmly, Pop explained. "She is on a crusade to protect those in her same predicament... Including you, Marie, only she thought she was alone."

"What predicament...?" Worried, Marie asked.

"She is pregnant, but, like you, did not have sex." Softly, Ms Rugby replied. "Word got out, and her life took a bad turn."

"From what she was willing to tell me, she went through what you all did and more." Serious, Pop said. "From being kicked out of her house to being beaten by her uncle, only she was willing to face it all alone."

"You are not alone!" Bolting up, Kevin exclaimed. "Not anymore!"

"Hear! Hear!" Standing up, Jimmy added.

Everyone's eyes turned bright blue for a moment, then returned to their original color, showing their support. Serafine gasped, taking a step back, before Pop produced a mirror from a table. "We are not Frenchmen or Americans." Calmly, he said. "We are all Gaians here, that includes you... You are not alone."

Tears fell from Serafine's face, and she ran to Marie before wrapping her arms around her, crying onto her shoulder. After a moment, Marie slowly returning her embrace. "Bienvenue à la Fraternité, Serafine... Welcome to the Sisterhood."

Moments later, Serafine, still trembling but more collected, stood in front of the microphone and began to sing. As she did, we all joined in.

We came from far away
Earth is a breath away
It could die any day
Came too far to fail today!

We need a plan
To save the humans
Anyone got a plan?
Got to save Earth from its fate.

Another planet torn!
Consumed by hate, creed and war!
There is time, it's not too late!
Pull them back from the brink...
Save this world from the mistakes we made

We can be heroes! To save the day!
Redemption for our world we slayed!
We can be heroes, give Earth new life
Save the humans in the nick of time!

When the number was finished, Marie and I turned to each other, smiling. "You're in."

Serafine gave the first genuine smile I had seen from her. "Merci...!"

That smile then vanished as she saw two adults approaching. "It's her parents..." Whispering, Ms Rugby said.

Pop frowned. "Are they now?" Darkly, he demanded.

"Your father is not about to challenge my parents, is he?" Wincing, Serafine asked.

I smiled. "Just watch." calmly, I said. "My stepdad is amazing..."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Serafine's heart.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
The man and woman marched toward the stage, speaking French. "Serafine, what are you doing up there?" Marie translated for me. "Come down from there, right now."

Pop stepped in front of Serafine. "May I help you?" he asked.

"This does not concern you, monsieur," the man said. "That is our daughter up there. She has been naughty, and must be disciplined."

"Serafine has told me what happened," Pop replied. "She has not been naughty, unless you wish to use that word in such a way as to leave it with no meaning."

"No meaning!" the woman practically shrieked. "If you have spoken to her, then you have heard her blasphemy! Is that a meaningless word to you?"

"Serafine has not blasphemed," Pop countered. "Yes, she is pregnant. True, she has not been touched by a man, though your brother attempted to change that. But she never claimed that her child was a gift from God, except in the way that all children are gifts."

"My brother... ?" Serafine's mother was brought up short by this revelation.

Pop nodded. "He learned, almost too late, that it is unwise to attack a Gaian woman when she is pregnant. Yes, you heard me correctly: Serafine is becoming Gaian, a process which has been accelerated by the cruelty inflicted on her by those who she has only loved."

Serafine's mother looked at her, helplessly, tears in her eyes. "Serafine,... is this... true?"

"Oui, mere," Serafine said, her eyes glowing blue through her tears. "Through me, an alien race is one step further away from extinction. I believed I was the only one, but I am part of a group,... a Sisterhood."

Serafine's mother came on stage and approached her, one hand extended in the direction of her daughter's belly. Serafine took her mother's hand and placed it on her bump.

Two generations of mothers embraced, weeping.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: Pop confront's Serafine's parents.

choices: We perform Gaia Deux for Ms Rugby.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"I am Belle Caron, and this is my husband, Raphael." Softly, Serafine's mother said. "It would seem we owe our daughter an apology,... though I still find all of this a bit overwhelming."

"I do hope your brother is recovering from his mistake of attacking a Gaian woman." Calmly, Ms Switch said.

Belle nodded. "He has a broken arm and a slight concussion from literally being thrown across the room." Softly, she said. "We did not believe it at first."

"For now, the world at large is unaware of us." Calmly, Pop said. "We would appreciate it if you helped keep it that way."

"So the play,... it was a historical record of your plight to save an entire world." Softly, Rafael said. "Incredible..." He cleared his throat. "It would seem we have acted prematurely and with haste, I can only hope you will forgive your foolish parents."

"The first lesson of motherhood..." Kindly, Ms Switch said. "Patience and forgiveness must become second nature."

Serafine smiled. "I forgive you... Uncle Hans, too."

The three shared a group hug before Serafine recited a poem, the one I had recited shortly after Pat had become a pregnant girl, what seemed like ages ago...

The realization came too late, no children will be born, we sealed our own fate.
To a primitive world dubbed a place to hide, it is our last hope to survive.
Young women with great hearts we must find, grant them the gift of what we leave behind.

"Is that the opening of the second play...?" Curious, Bella asked.

Marie nodded. "The play focuses on a desperate plan to integrate the Gaian race in with the human race." Calmly, she said. "They followed the path of the Mayan..."

"So the Mayans were aliens..." Shocked, Raphael said.

"Not your Mayans." Bemused, Pop said. "Myains in Gaian means nomads."

"The plan to save the Earth was to give those they... well... seeded with knowledge of their world." Softly, I said. I sighed. "As well as their mistakes."

"I would recommend using fictitious names for this play." Serious, Raphael said. "I am assuming it is about your experiences in the States."

"As well as theirs here." Serious, Ms Switch replied. "We are using the same characters from the first, with made-up names for those who were chosen to carry on the Gaian race."

Raphael nodded. "How can we help?"
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: First Lessons in Motherhood

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
And so it was thatGaia Deux was performed for the first time. I was touched by one song in particular, written from the perspective of one of the Gaian children, and the girl who would be his mother:

They came across the endless starways
Coming fast to lend a hand
A smile as gentle as Earth and water
A voice as smooth as the sand
In that moment when you meet someone
In that one glimpse when all time stands still
All of your dreams at once come true
And your destiny is fulfilled!

It seems I searched forever for the one
Then you appear, shining like the sun
When fates align like yours and mine
I know you are the one
My search is over, I know you are the one

We all share a strange mystery
We meet at the same hotel
A blue light enters with all silence
And enters us - or did we dream?
You had come to me a stranger
Now you are my child-to-be
Our future now seems so unclear
Questions with answers out of reach

It seems I searched forever for the one
Then you appeared, a shining blue sun
When fates align like yours and mine
I know you are the one

Our search is over,... I know you are the one

Then I was pulled back into reality. "Where's Kevin?"

"Bathroom," Serafine said. "Why?"

"JD has a present."

"Allow me. I will need practice, non?" She brought JD to a flat surface.

"Oh, Serafine, you'd better be careful, he might - "

"Merde!"

I pulled out some wipes and cleaned Serafine's face. "Your second lesson in motherhood," I said with a grin. "Put the fresh diaper under a girl, and over a boy."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: We perform Gaia Deux for Ms Rugby.

choices: pregnant, she does not know the father.
now an orphan, her parents died.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
Like in the states, pieces of the first performance of Gaia Deux somehow found their way to the press, and soon, all of Paris was abuzz with the upcoming sequel. Many were very curious to witness the production coming together. Fortunately, Pangaea Academy had a fine security staff. Maribel grudgingly participated, though she did give everything a hundred percent in her own way. She handled the dance choreography.

"No... No... NO!" Hurrying onto the stage, she yelled. "Look at your feet, Rose... If you spin turn with only one heel up like a ballerina, you are going to put too much pressure onto your ankle!" She scoffed. "Are you trying to break it?!"

"I- I guess I got carried away..." Blushing, Rose said.

"You need to stay focused." More softly, Maribel scolded. "Both feet on the floor, with your back straight, and eyes to the audience."

As she walked back to stage right, I turned to Ms Rugby. "I know it's none of my business, but what's Maribel's story?"

Ms Rugby sighed. "She is the sole heir to a multi-billion-euro fortune." Softly, she explained. "Her parents are always off on some business trip or adventure, taking in all life has to offer."

"Why don't they take her with them?" Wincing, I asked.

Ms Rugby shook her head, a hint of anger in her eyes. "She is a trophy child... her birth and achievements are only used to be paraded, to enhance her parents' status."

This revelation stunned me. All I could do in response was to whisper, "What....?!"

"She has been a ward of this school ever since she was born, taken out only when it suited her parents' egos or agendas." Whispering, Ms Rugby said. "What is worse..."

"What...?" Whispering, I pressed.

Tears began to fall from Ms Rugby's eyes. "Maribel.... she is..."
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The First Review

choices: Maribel's parents deny having a child.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
"Is it a Gaian child?" Worried, I asked.

Ms Rugby nodded. "It is... but she knows that because she is pregnant, she no longer suits her parent's egos or agendas." Sadly, she replied. "She has not told them yet."

"So she acts out like she does because..." Wincing, I began.

"Because she sees wealth as a poison." Serious, Ms Rugby said. "A destroyer of families and of worlds."

"She is not too far off." Sadly, I said. "Maybe all she needs is some real love."

Then a thought came to me. "Marie... If it's alright with you, we would like Maribel to sing the number, Kick Greed Out."

"Me...?" Surprised, Maribel asked. She hid a blush. "I'm not a singer.... not really."

"We think you can bring real emotion to the song." Serious, Ms Rugby said. "Please give it a try... we want all Gaians to have a role."

Maribel's eyes shined a bright blue for a moment before returning to their normal color, then she jumped as she saw everyone around her respond in kind. Pop walked up to Maribel. "As we told Serafine, you are not alone... you are a part of a race pulling away from the brink of extinction, helping a race on the same dangerous path." He held out his hand. "Will you help us find our way home...?"

Maribel's eyes overflowed with tears. "My family will disown me when they learn I am pregnant, regardless of where it came from." Tearfully, she said.

"This family will never leave you." Firmly but kindly, Pop said. "Not ever."

Hope flashed in Maribel's eyes... "You... promise...?"

"We promise." Came a chorus of voices.

Maribel looked around at everyone smiling kindly at her. She touched her abdomen, tears falling, then nodded. "I will sing."

Marie handed her the music sheet for the number, and we began playing the music with the new instruments, and Maribel began to sing...

Wealth is nothing without love
Why can't we all get that straight
We lost our world to greed and hate
The blame is ours not the Gods above

We must fight our hate and greed
It's that or slowly die
The Gods blessed us with a second chance
Ask and we tell you why

We need to kick greed out
Need to bring love home!
We need to kick hate out
This is where we all went wrong!

We can't judge this world
We too dragged ourselves down
But we feel helpless standing here
watching again all going down.

I see all the hate and greed
like a mirror looking back at me
When I think of what might have been
I weep for both worlds about to give in!

We need to kick greed out
Need to bring love home!
We need to kick hate out
This is where we all went wrong!

After the number was finished, Maribel fell to her knees crying. "Why can't they just love me...?"

"They are blinded by greed and pride." Gently, Pop said. "Fear not, we will show them the error of their ways, and open their hearts to a new way of thinking."

Marie stepped up and pulled Maribel into a hug. "Bienvenue à la Fraternité, Maribel,... Welcome to the Sisterhood."

"I will call her parents in." Serious, Ms Rugby said. "I have been waiting for the chance to knock that snobbish couple down a peg or two."

"I think Maribel is first in line." Serious, Pop said.

Maribel nodded, with a renewed sense of confidence.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: pregnant, she does not know the father.

1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.content:
We had just finished rehearsals for the day when Maribel's parents entered the auditorium and walked directly towards their daughter. Everyone came to the stage in support of her, with Marie and me in the front. I was angry, outraged, that anyone, regardless of wealth, would treat their own child as a trophy or prized possession. Before I could stop myself, my eyes glowed a bright blue, before returning to their original color as I almost literally screamed, "How dare you treat your own flesh and blood like a trophy to be paraded around?"

The eyes of everyone around me glowed a bright blue in response to my outburst, to which the couple took a step back, shock on their faces. Only, instead of running or screaming back, their eyes glowed the same bright blue color before they both bowed their heads. "Is that how you see us, daughter?" Softly, her mother demanded. "Parents who only care for you when it suits us?"

"How else do you explain leaving me here year after year while you go who knows where, living life to its fullest?!" Crying, Maribel demanded.

The father sighed. "The most precious resource, more valuable than all the gem stones of the world, are our children." Firmly, he said. "They must be protected."

Then, to our surprise, they both sang a short number... one which made Pop and Mrs Switch gasp, then cry as they sang along...

Songs sung throughout the ages
Truths locked in memory for you to find it
Songs live longer than any pages
Reminders of what we left behind!

Locked deep inside the lyrics
You struggle to see the story behind it
A vision of a world far away
A cry in the dark then all is silent!

Again and again you listen intently
Hoping, Praying to hear the message again...
You hear the foreshadowing
Those in power still insist to be blinded
With tears in our hearts, we fled away!

Our world was beyond saving
Are they listening now? It's too late
We must never break our home again
We left to show the path to the light!

We were all shocked, even stunned. Maribel's parents were Gaians... Pop stepped forward after the song had been sung, and began to speak in a language that sounded like a mixture of different Indian dialects. Maribel's parents responded in the same dialect, in a short exchange, before the mother crumpled to the floor, sobbing.

"This is Bard and Belle Caron." Serious, Pop said. "They are the descendants of the nomads who had left Gaia ages before us."

"That doesn't explain why..." Wincing, Maribel began.

"Those in power here are just as blind as those we had left on Gaia." Weeping, Mrs Caron said. "We had feared what they would do to you if they ever discovered your alien origins."

"We had enough practice to keep our origins a secret, despite our wealth, but you would be discovered if kept too close to the spotlight." Sadly, Mr. Caron said. "So we hid you away and kept you safe."

"Only in doing so, we have pushed our angel away..." Still weeping, Mrs Caron said.

"The humans have a saying." Calmly Ms Switch said. "It is never too late to be what you might have been."

Maribel stepped forward. "We are all Gaians here." Softly, she said. She offered her hand. "Please join our family..."

Slowly, hesitantly, Mrs Caron took Maribel's hand and they shared an emotional embrace, which Mr Caron soon joined with the rest of us. Gaians reunited after an eternity of being stars apart.

"The stories you must have..." After the embrace ended, I said.

"The stories you must have." Smiling, Mr Caron countered. "We had thought we would never see our ancestors' home world until Gaia hit the theaters."

"We're now working on Gaia Deux." smiling back, I said.

Mr and Mrs Caron nodded. "We will make certain it is played on the grandest stage." Mr Caron said. "The Theatre de La Ville."

We all turned to each other, smiling. Gaia Deux was closer to a reality.
1111211111111121112121211121211111122111.title: The Nomads.

112.content:
I was pale as a ghost when Doctor Foster walked into the room. She’d been my doctor for the last few years, ever since I started puberty. Looking at a clipboard, she said, “So Cassie, what seems to be the problem today?”

“I was feeling really nauseous this morning; it just came out of nowhere.” Taking a breath, I said, “Oddly enough, I started feeling better as we drove into the parking lot.”

“That’s interesting.” Looking at the clipboard, she said, “It seems your temperature and blood pressure are slightly elevated. Have you experienced any other symptoms than nausea?”

“Now that you mention it, I’ve been going to the bathroom more often.” Pausing, I said, “But that’s nothing serious, right?”

Without acknowledging me, Dr. Foster said, “When was your last period?”

“It was about three weeks ago.” Sighing, I said, “It was lighter than usual, but it was only a few days late.”

“Have you been sexually active in the last few months?”

I was growing confused by Dr. Foster’s line of questioning – what did any of this have to do with my symptoms? “No, Doctor, I’m not sexually active.” Looking at Mom, I said, “I’ve never even had a boyfriend.”

“Doctor Foster.” Taking my hand, Mom said, “It sounds to me like you think Cassie’s pregnant.”

“I’m just getting all the information I can, Mrs. Pennant.” Looking at me, she said, “I’m just going to order some tests; to see what we can rule out.”
112.title: At the Doctor's Office, Part 1

1121.content:
After getting my blood drawn and leaving a urine sample, I waited back in the room with Mom. An hour passed before Doctor Foster walked back into the room. “Well Cassie, we’ve got our answer.” Looking at me, she said, “You’re pregnant.”

“You’re joking, right?” looking at her, I said, “I told you, I’m a virgin.”

“The tests say otherwise.”

“How dare you!” placing both hands on my shoulder, Mom said, “Dr. Foster; if my daughter says she’s a virgin, who are you to say she’s lying?”

I was starting to feel nauseous again – how could I be pregnant!?

Showing me the clipboard with the test results, she said, “Both the blood and urine tests showed that your body is producing HCG; a hormone that's related to pregnancy.” Pausing, she said, “Women who aren’t pregnant don’t produce this hormone; so if you are, logically, that means you’re pregnant.”

“Your tests are wrong!” starting to tear up, I said, “I’m a virgin, you can examine me yourself if you want to.”

“I’m afraid that won’t prove anything, Cassie; the hymen isn’t a factory seal. There are many things that can break it.”

At this point, Mom had enough. Grabbing our things from a nearby chair, she said, “Come along, Cassie, let’s go home.”

As I followed Mom out to the car, I was still trying to wrap my head around everything. How could I possibly be pregnant?
1121.title: At the Doctor's Office, Part 2

11211.content:
I wasn’t really in the mood to eat anything, but I didn’t object when Mom stopped at McDonald’s on the way home. After we got the food, Mom parked the car in a nearby spot. Taking my burger, I was about to take a bite when I noticed Mom looking at me. It didn’t take a genius to figure out what she was thinking – she wasn’t buying my story. “Would you please stop looking at me like that, Mom?” putting down the burger, I said, “I don’t care what those tests say, I can assure you that I’m not pregnant!”

“I want to believe you, Cassie, but I know what it’s like to be a teenage girl.” Looking at me, she said, “I’m not angry, I just want to know the truth.”

“I’m telling you the truth, Mom; I’ve never slept with a boy!” sighing, I said, “I spend my free time at home; so you tell me when I would possibly have the chance to have sex?”

“I love you, sweetie; but I have to ask you some questions.” Pausing, Mom said, “Have you ever accepted a strange drink at a party in the last few months?”

“I’ve never been to a high school party in my life.”

“Have you ever fallen asleep at school?”

Is she serious? “God, Mom, no!” starting to tear up, I said, “Mom, there’s absolutely no way I can be pregnant.”

“How can you be so sure?”

“Because I’m a lesbian, Mom!”

If I'd had more of a choice, I'd have made my coming-out announcement much differently: in the living room, the whole family there, maybe Cindy holding my hand. Oh, well, too late to take it back now. Mom had a shocked look on her face, as she tried to process what I’d just told her. “Y-You’re a lesbian?”

“Believe me, this isn’t remotely close to how I wanted to tell you.” Sighing, I said, “Please don’t be mad at me.”

“How could I be mad at you?” Pulling me in for a hug, Mom said, “I’d love you whether you were gay or straight.”

I was starting to tear up again. After pulling away from the hug, I said, “Now that we have that cleared up, do you believe me when I say I’ve never had sex with a guy?”

“That just leaves the question of how you could have possibly gotten pregnant.” Looking at me, she said, “Do you have a girlfriend or anything?”

“I wouldn’t exactly call her my girlfriend; she hasn’t come out to her folks yet.” Pausing, I said, “Her name is Cindy. She’s a sophomore.”

“I would love to meet her at some point.”

“I suppose that could be arranged.” Sighing, I said, “I just have to figure out how to tell her that I’m pregnant.”
11211.title: After the Doctor's Office

112111.content:
The rest of the car ride went by in silence. Mom was trying to wrap her head around everything, while I was trying to figure out how to tell Cindy I was pregnant. I soon decided to go to her house and talk with her, hoping that she’d be okay with it.

But that plan went right out the window; because, as Mom rounded the corner, I saw Cindy sitting on my front porch with some bags next to her. Once Mom parked the car in the driveway, I got out of the car and went up to her.

Given everything that’d happened, I didn’t hesitate to give Cindy a kiss. She reciprocated the kiss for a moment, until she saw my Mom walking towards us. Breaking the kiss, she said, “Cass, your mom’s coming up the walk.”

“Don’t worry, she knows about us.” Turning to Mom, holding Cindy’s hand in mine, I said, “Mom, I’d like you to meet Cindy Rogers – my girlfriend.”

Cindy and Mom exchanged a polite if awkward, introduction. “It’s lovely to meet you, Cindy.”

“It’s nice to meet you too, Mrs. Pennant.” Smiling, Cindy said, “Cass keeps telling me how amazing you are.”

I was starting to blush, so I turned my attention to the bags on the porch. “What’s with the bags, Cindy?”

“Oh that?” A frown on her face, Cindy said, “My, uh, folks kicked me out.”

“What?” shocked, I said, “Did you tell them you were a lesbian or something?”

“No, it’s nothing like that.” Taking a deep breath, Cindy said, “I’m not sure how to tell you this, but I’m pregnant.”
112111.title: A Surprise Visit

1121111.content:
I hugged Cindy as soon as she said it. Maybe I just needed contact with her to prove to myself that this was all really happening, I don't know.

"I swear," she said, "I don't know how it could have happened. You're the only one I've ever been with."

Mom didn't say much. She just picked up the heaviest bags and said, "Let's get you settled in, Cindy."

Cindy was surprised when Mom brought the bags up to my room. "The guest room will be fine, Mrs. Pennant."

"Don't be silly," Mom said, "why would I put your things in the guest room, when we all know where you'll be sleeping? Besides, we'll be needing the guest room for other purposes." She abruptly changed the subject. "Have you eaten, Cindy?"

"Not much," she said, "I'm having trouble keeping it down."

"How about some lemon-lime soda and saltines?"

"Maybe."

As we began making room for her things, Cindy said, "You're taking this awfully well. I would have thought you'd have a little more trouble believing me."

"Maybe, before today, I would have," I said.

"What happened today?"

"I found out I was pregnant."
1121111.title: Continue

11211111.content:
As one would expect, Cindy was rather surprised to learn that I was also pregnant. Sitting on the bed next to me, she said, “Well, aren’t we the world’s worst lesbians?”

“We’ll figure this out, Cindy.” Grasping her hand in mine, I said, “There’s got to be a reasonable explanation as to how we got pregnant.”

“It’s not like we’re out there having sex with boys.” Looking at me, she said, “Hell, we haven’t even gone that far yet.”

Cindy was right; the furthest we’d taken our relationship was making out in her bedroom with our shirts off. Lying down on the bed, I said, “I’ll be honest, this is not how I saw our relationship going.”

“Me neither.” Lying down next to me, Cindy rested her head on my shoulder. “But at least we can get through this together.”

The two of us lay on my bed for a few minutes, in complete silence. Cindy must’ve been tired; because she soon fell asleep. I was on the verge of dozing off myself when Mom walked into the room carrying a tray with soda and saltines. Seeing Cindy and me together on the bed, she smiled and said, “She’s a very lovely girl, Cassie.”

“I know.” Smiling, I said, “I really appreciate you being so supportive about this.”

“You’re my daughter; I’d love you regardless.” Quietly setting the tray down, careful not to wake Cindy, Mom said, “If you don’t mind my asking, how’d you two meet?”

“You remember a few months ago, that field trip to the Natural History Museum?” pausing, I said, “Well, Cindy and I were partnered together; we got to talking, and found out we had a lot in common. One thing led to another, and we started dating almost two months ago.”

Getting up from the bed, Mom said, “I’ll give you two some privacy.”
11211111.title: Two Pregnant Lesbians

112111111.content:
It was another couple hours before Cindy and I woke up. As we lay together on the bed, Cindy looked at me and said, “Do we have to get up? This is the best I’ve felt in a long time.”

“Believe me, I want nothing more than to lay in bed with you.” Kissing Cindy, I said, “But my step-dad and step-brother are going to be home soon.”

Sitting up, Cindy said, “Do you think they’ll be okay with...well, us?”

“I think they’ll be blindsided; what with the pregnancies and us being a couple. But,” sitting up, I said, “I’m sure they’ll be cool about it.”

“I hope so.” Looking at me, Cindy said, “Otherwise, I’m not sure where else I can go.”

“Hey, don’t talk like that.” Pulling Cindy in for a hug, I said, “What kind of girlfriend would I be if I allowed you to be homeless?”

After breaking the hug, Cindy went over to the tray on the nightstand. Opening a can of soda, she grabbed a handful of saltines. Taking a bite, she said, “So once all this is out of the way, then what’s next?”

“Then we find out how this could have happened.” Grabbing another can of soda, I said, “Two teenage lesbians don’t just get pregnant.”
112111111.title: Later On

1121111111.content:
It was just around 2:30 when Pat and Pop got home. Normally, Pop would’ve been home by now, working 1st shift, but he had to stay late for a staff meeting. Cindy and I were sitting on the couch, watching TV, when they came inside.

Having gotten used to hiding our relationship from her parents, Cindy quickly removed my arm from her shoulder and sat up. Before they got within earshot, I turned to her and said, “Babe, we don’t need to hide anymore.”

“Sorry.” Wincing, Cindy said, “It’s just a force of habit.”

Pop walked into the living room and saw us sitting on the couch. “Cassie, your mom said you weren’t feeling well this morning.”
Looking at me, he said, “Are you feeling okay?’

“Not really.” Seeing Pat and Mom walk into the room, I said, “I’m pregnant.”

Once their initial shock wore off, Pop looked at me and said, “You’re pregnant?” Getting annoyed, he said, “Honey, I thought we taught you better than that.”

“Please Pop, it’s not like that; I haven’t had sex with any guys.”

“Then how do you explain the pregnancy?”

“I don’t know; Cindy and I are trying to figure that out.” Casting a quick glance at Cindy, I said, “She’s pregnant, too.”

“Two pregnant girls, both of whom claim they’ve never slept with a boy.” Looking at the two of us, Pop said, “I’m sorry, but I don’t buy that.”

Cindy was starting to get nervous, as this must’ve been bringing back memories of talking with her folks.

“We’re telling you the truth, Pop; neither of us has had sex with a guy.” Turning to Pop, I said, “We’re both lesbians.”

As if the pregnancy wasn’t shocking enough, I feared I overdid it with the whole lesbian thing. Pat was looking at us with a shocked look on his face; while Pop just stood there silently. After a moment, he said, “Are you two...”

"Yes, we’ve been dating for almost 2 months.”

Once the initial shock wore off, Pop and Pat both introduced themselves to Cindy; who took it all in stride. After the introductions had been made, and Pat had left the room, Mom and Pop sat down with Cindy and me. Looking at us, Mom said, “So now that everyone knows, I suppose we have a big mystery on our hands.”

“I’ll say.” Glancing at me, Cindy said, “I’d love to find out how we both got pregnant.”
1121111111.title: Talking to Pop & Pat

11211111111.content:
It took Pop some time to accept everything we’d just thrown at him. But once he did, he promised to take care of both Cindy and myself. After he left the room, Pat came over and sat in the chair across from us. “So, sis, you’re a lesbian?”

“Yeah, I’m a lesbian.” Looking at him, I said, “Are you okay with that?”

“Of course I’m okay with it, why wouldn’t I be?” chuckling, Pat said, “Now I have someone I can watch girls with at the mall.”

“Like hell you are.” With a mock annoyance, Cindy turned to me and said, “You better not go looking for another girlfriend now that I’m pregnant.”

“Why would I do that?” kissing Cindy, I said, “I have the best girlfriend in the world.”

“Likewise, babe.”

Cindy and I quickly started kissing each other; totally oblivious to Pat watching from the chair. It must’ve been getting awkward for him, because he stood up and said, “I-I’m going to give you two some privacy.”

“Oh come on, Pat.” Chuckling, Cindy said, “I thought it was every guy’s fantasy to watch two girls making out.”

“It is.” Blushing, Pat said, “I’d just prefer it if one of them wasn’t my older sister.”

“Come on, babe.” Getting up, I looked at Cindy and said, “Let's go upstairs to my room; where we can be alone.”

“Sounds good to me.”
11211111111.title: Continue

112111111111.content:
We didn't get too crazy in my room; we figured nighttime would be more appropriate for initiating our status as a lesbian couple. But there was absolutely nothing wrong with getting topless, kissing, and fondling each other's breasts. Besides, we wanted to do that for as long as we could, before both sets got too tender.

During a break from such goings-on, Cindy asked the million-dollar question: "How do you think we got pregnant?"

"If I knew that," I said, "it would be on the news." I spread my arms, as if describing a headline. "Local Teen Proves Men Aren't Necessary."

"You don't suppose it could be - " She rolled her eyes in the direction of the ceiling.

"Well," I said, "I don't know if I believe in God, so I'm an odd choice for that honor. Second, God asked if it was okay last time, but I didn't get so much as an introduction, so that's just plain rude. Third, getting both of us pregnant at the same time seems like overdoing it."

"I guess you're right," Cindy replied. "Maybe part of me was hoping this baby would be... special."

"You're its mother. Special is a guarantee."

"Flatterer. Okay, let's think about what we've got in common."

"We're a couple, we've got everything in common," I laughed. "We'd need a third unexplained pregnancy to find a pattern."

Cindy giggled. "That would be ridiculous, wouldn't it?"
112111111111.title: Upstairs

1121111111111.content:
Cindy and I were snuggling on the bed, watching a movie, when my bedroom door opened. Before we could say anything, Trish walked into the room. Seeing us on the bed, she chuckled and said, “At least I didn’t walk in on you two making out, like last time.”

“We were doing that earlier.” Grinning, Cindy said, “What’s up, Trish?”

“I got Cassie’s text, so I came straight over.” Looking at me, she said, “Are you really pregnant?”

“It sure seems that way.” Sitting up, I said, “The strange thing is, so is Cindy.”

Trish had a knack for talking without thinking. Looking at us, she said, “Wow, you two are the worst lesbians in the world.”

“That’s what I said when I found out she was pregnant.” Sitting next to me, Cindy said, “In all seriousness, we have no idea how this could have happened.”

Pulling my chair up to the bed, Trish sat down and looked at Cindy. “How are you guys doing with this?”

“All things considered, things could be better.” Taking Cindy’s hand, I said, “Her parents kicked her out when she told them about the pregnancy.”

“Oh my God!” looking at Cindy, Trish said, “Cin, I’m so sorry.”

“It’s not your fault; apparently my parent’s unconditional support doesn’t include when their daughter tells them she’s pregnant.” Sighing, Cindy said, “But at least Cassie’s family is letting me stay here, although I’m not sure Mrs. Pennant is 100% okay with the idea of us sleeping together.”

“Speaking of which,” looking at the two of us, Trish said, “Please spare me the details, but, uh, what’s this going to do for your...sex life?”

“We haven’t gotten to that point yet.” Pausing, I said, “So, with both of us being pregnant, I’d say it’s not going to do it any good.”

“You know I’m here for both of you.” Getting up, Trish said, “If you need my helping figuring this out, I’ll be more than happy to do what I can.”

“Thanks.”
1121111111111.title: Trish Pays a Visit

11211111111111.content:
A few hours had passed, and we had just finished having dinner. While Pat went upstairs to play some videogames, Cindy and I stayed downstairs with Pop. Having adjourned to the living room, Pop sat down and said, “Okay, I think it’s time we start trying to figure all of this out.”

“I suppose you’re right, Pop.” Sighing, I said, “Although I’m not sure how to do that.”

“I’m disappointed in you, Cassie; after all those episodes of CSI we watched.” Looking at us, Pop said, “We have to start by figuring out if you two have anything in common – and I don’t mean that you’re both lesbians.”

Aside from both of us having the same gynecologist, I honestly couldn’t think of anything. But I did know that Pop was right. Turning to Cindy, I said, “How far along did Dr. Foster say you were?”

“About 9 weeks along.” Taking a breath, Cindy said, “How about you?”

“She said I was about 7 weeks along.”

“That’s a start.” Looking at us, Pop said, “Do either of you remember doing anything in particular about that time?”

I didn’t remember much about that time; except for having a rather intense physical exam at Dr. Foster’s office. I’d been through several of them in the last few years, but this one seemed to be particularly thorough. “Now that you mention it, Pop; I do remember having a physical exam with Dr. Foster.” Pausing, I said, “I didn’t think much about it at the time; but I do remember having to be sedated for a portion of it.”

I must’ve been onto something there, because, suddenly, Cindy gasped. “Oh my God! The same thing happened to me.”

Looking at the two of us, Pop said, “Have either of you ever been sedated during an exam before?”

Both of us shook our heads. “No, sir.”

“I think we should pay Dr. Foster a visit tomorrow, because something doesn’t add here.” Pausing, Pop said, “The chances of two young girls going for a physical exam, and being sedated, are pretty slim.”

“Now that you mention it, Pop; I did notice Dr. Foster seemed... almost happy when she said I was pregnant.”

“That clinches it. We’re going to the clinic tomorrow morning.” Getting up, Pop said, “It’s getting kind of late. Why don’t you girls go upstairs to bed?”

****************************


A short time later, Cindy and I were walking out of my private bathroom. As I pulled the sheets down, I said, “Do you think Pop’s right? Could Dr. Foster have something to do with this?”

“I don’t know, but it does seem a tad coincidental.” Climbing into bed, Cindy said, “I guess we’ll find out tomorrow.”

“I guess you’re right.” Climbing into bed, I said, “Good night, babe.”

Leaning over to kiss me, Cindy said, “Good night.”

It wasn’t long before the two of us fell asleep while spooning with each other. As I drifted off to sleep, I found myself thinking, My girlfriend and I may be pregnant, but we’ll get through this together.
11211111111111.title: That Night

112111111111111.content:
I was awakened early the next morning, around 6:45, by the sound of a toilet flushing in the bathroom. Rolling over, I saw that Cindy was no longer in bed, so I quickly realized what was going on.

Climbing out of bed, I walked over to the bathroom door and peeked inside, to find Cindy kneeling on the floor in front of the toilet.
“Morning.”

“Morning.” Looking up at me, Cindy said, “I’d kiss you, but I just threw up.”

“Yeah, I’d rather wait then.” Walking into the bathroom, I knelt down on the floor next to Cindy. “How long have you been up?”

“About an hour. I was trying not to wake you.”

“I probably wouldn’t have slept much longer anyway; it’s Saturday morning, and Pat likes to wake up early to play video games.”

After another round of vomiting, Cindy wiped her mouth and said, “My mom used to tell me that she had terrible morning sickness when she was pregnant with me.” Sighing, Cindy said, “I see that I followed in her footsteps. Let’s just hope I don’t disown my child when I’m older.”

“Hey, don’t talk like that.” As Cindy started to cry, I wrapped my arms around her and held her close. “What your folks did was terrible, but you’re also a much better person than they are.”

“Aren’t you just saying that because you’re my girlfriend?”

“I’d be saying it even if I wasn’t your girlfriend.” Leaning over, I kissed Cindy on the top of her head. “We’ll get through this, babe.”

Cindy leaned over and rested her head on my shoulder. Looking up at me, she said, “Have I told you lately that I love you?”

Suddenly I started to feel nauseous myself. Raising a finger, as I leaned over the toilet, I said, “Hold that thought.”
112111111111111.title: The Next Morning

1121111111111111.content:
For some reason, Pat really wanted to come along with us to Dr. Foster’s clinic, but, thankfully, Pop wouldn’t let him. I figured it must’ve had something to do with a need to keep Cindy and me safe. I had to remember to thank him for being so concerned.

As we drove to the clinic, I passed the time by looking out the window. I must’ve zoned out for a moment, because I was suddenly aware of Cindy and Pop having a conversation. “Mr. Pennant, what are you going to do if we find out Dr. Foster is somehow involved?”

“If that’s the case, then I’m going to do everything I can to make sure she pays for what happened to you girls.” Glancing behind him, Pop said, “If she’s willing to abuse her patients like that, she has no business being a doctor.”

We arrived at the clinic a few minutes later, to find almost half a dozen cop cars out front. “What’s going on here, Pop?”

“I don’t know, sweetie.” Parking the car, Pop said, “Let me go find out.”

Cindy and I stood at the back of the car, while Pop went to speak with one of the officers. As we waited, I noticed a girl around our age crying into an older woman’s arms. Pointing her out to Cindy, I said, “You don’t think... ?”

“I honestly don’t know what to think anymore.”

Before we could discuss it further, Pop came back over. “It seems the cops raided the clinic this morning, after some parents raised concerns about the treatments their daughters were receiving here.”

“What kind of treatments?”

“He wouldn’t go into detail, but some parents mentioned their daughters receiving IUDs against their will. A few even mentioned their daughters being violated.”

“What if that means they did something to us while we were sedated?”

“That’s looking more and more plausible, sweetie.”

Before we could finish speaking, the older woman and the girl came over to us. “I’m sorry to interrupt, but were your daughters patients here?”

“Only one of them is my daughter, ma’am; but yes, they’re both patients here.”

“If you don’t mind my asking, what happened to them?”

“They’re both pregnant.”
1121111111111111.title: Visiting Dr. Foster

11211111111111111.content:
"You, too?" asked the girl.

I nodded. "I'm Cassie, and this is my girlfriend, Cindy."

"Teresa," she said, and we shook hands.

"When Teresa told me, and that she... she'd never... I didn't know what to believe."

"You're doing better than my folks," Cindy said. "They kicked me out when I told them."

"And you... ?"

I shook my head. "Not even with each other."

I guess, for her, two teenage lesbians just weren't shocking enough anymore. "Three virgin pregnancies... There will be more, won't there?"

"I'm almost certain of it."

While we were all talking, a news van pulled up, and a reporter came up to us. "Excuse me," she said, "would you care to make a statement about what has happened here?"

"No, I would not."

******************************


When we got home, Pop told Mom everything he had learned. "There are bound to be more, if we're already up to three."

"Agreed."

"Sorry I couldn't be there," Pat said.

"Why would you want to?" I asked.

"You're my sister," he said, "and Cindy's one of my classmates. Why wouldn't I want to help you any way I could?"
11211111111111111.title: Continue

112111111111111111.content:
After everything that happened at the clinic, Pop decided it was best for Cindy and me to stay inside. I wanted to argue that, but I soon realized he was right. So, while Pop was busy trying to figure out our legal options, I was upstairs with Pat and Cindy.

“Doesn’t it seem a bit strange that three girls, who have the same doctor, all end up pregnant after having a physical?” Pat asked.

“It’s more than strange, Pat.” Sighing, I said, “It’s downright creepy; I’m feeling pretty violated right now.”

“Same here.” Looking at me, Cindy said, “We trusted Dr. Foster, but it seems she abused that trust.”

“So who's this other girl?” pausing, Pat said, “Does she go to our school?”

“Her name’s Teresa, and she lives in the next town over.” Looking at Pat, I said, “If you’re thinking what I think you are, you can forget it.”

“I don’t know what you’re talking about.”

“I’m your older sister, dummy.” Sighing, I said, “You want to know if there’s a chance you could ask her out or something.”

“Geez Pat, seriously?” scoffing, Cindy said, “She just found out she’s pregnant, I think the last thing on her mind would be her social life.”

“I wasn’t going to ask her out; I just...well, you two have each other. What if she doesn’t have anyone to confide in, besides her mom?”

I had to realize Pat did have a point. “If it makes you feel better, I’ll talk to her.” Sighing, I said, “Just promise me, if she agrees to meet you, you’ll keep it in your pants.”

“Oh please, it’s not like anything could happen.” Chuckling, Pat said, “She’s already pregnant.”

Cindy and I couldn’t help but glare at Pat. Looking at him, I said, “Here’s a piece of friendly advice: Don’t get a pregnant girl angry.”
112111111111111111.title: Chatting With Pat

1121111111111111111.content:
Pat left the room a few minutes later, followed by Cindy making a beeline for the bathroom. Alone in the room, I grabbed my phone and called the number Teresa had given me. It rang for a moment before she answered.
“Hello?”

“Hey Teresa, its Cassie.”

“Hey, I was hoping you’d call.” Sighing, Teresa said, “I wanted to apologize for my crying this morning.”

“You don’t have to apologize. Believe me, I know how you feel.”

“My mom said she’s going to hire a lawyer to go after the clinic.” Pausing, she said, “What is your dad planning?”

“He’s actually my stepdad, but I really don’t know what he’s planning right now.” Pausing, I said, “Hey, I know we just met, but would you feel like having a sleepover or something?”

“That sounds great right now. I could use a distraction.” Chuckling, Teresa said, “I’ll have to ask my mom, but I don’t think she’d mind.”

“Great, I’ll text you my address.” Smiling, I said, “See you soon.”

“See you soon.”
1121111111111111111.title: Talking with Teresa

11211111111111111111.content:
Teresa's mom dropped her off at 6:00 that night. The three of us got into our jammies soon after.

"How far along are you guys?" Teresa asked.

"6 to 8 weeks," I replied.

"8 to 10," said Cindy. "You?"

"Three months. I know what you're thinking, I should have noticed something. And I did. But, since I hadn't had sex, pregnancy just didn't occur to me. Hard to argue with this, though."

She pulled out a picture and showed it to us. It was an ultrasound.

"How far do you think this goes?" I asked.

"What do you mean?"

"Three virgins just don't get pregnant out of nowhere. And Foster doesn't have the equipment to do this herself. Somebody wanted us to have his children."
11211111111111111111.title: The Sleepover

112111111111111111111.content:
The three of us stayed up until around 10:00; we mostly talked and watched movies. With everything that was going on, the sleepover was the most normal thing to happen in a while.

When I woke up the next morning, I found that Teresa and Cindy were already awake. Hearing a flushing noise from the bathroom, I realized someone was in there. Walking into the room, I saw Cindy standing in front of the toilet with her back to me.

Walking up behind her, i wrapped my arms around her waist and kissed her on the cheek. "I could get used to seeing you when I wake up."

"I appreciate the sentiment, but don't you think Cindy might get angry?"

Huh? Cindy turned around to face me; revealing that I had in fact just kissed Teresa. "Oh my God!" Blushing, I said, "Teresa, I-I'm so sorry!"

"It's okay." Blushing, Teresa said, "That was a nice, albeit slightly awkward, way to start the day."

"Have you seen Cindy?"

"No, she was gone when I woke up."

"Huh, I wonder where..."

Before I could finish my sentence, I was interrupted by someone loudly banging on the front door. This was quickly followed by someone yelling, "Where's my daughter!"

Teresa and I ran downstairs to see what was going on, as Cindy and Pat came running out of the kitchen. I didn't have time to ask what was going on before Pop walked to the door and slowly opened it. "Can I help you?"

The door pushed open to reveal Cindy's dad, who looked furious. "I want to know where my daughter is!"

Standing next to Pat, who was holding her hand in support, Cindy said, "I-I'm right here, daddy!"

Seeing Pat and Cindy holding hands did nothing to dampen Mr. Roger's emotions. In fact it had quite the opposite effect. "So you're the horny bastard who got my little girl pregnant!"

"No sir, it's not what..."

Before anyone of us could react, Mr. Rogers came over and punched Pat square in the nose.
112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1121111111111111111111.content:
Pop spun Mr. Rogers around. "You need to explain why you felt entitled to hurt my son," he said. "And you'd better make it good, or he gets to walk around saying 'You should see the other guy.'"

Mr. Rogers didn't look impressed. "How do you expect me to treat the little bastard who got my little girl pregnant?"

"First off," Pop said, "I'm not forgetting that you kicked her out when she was scared out of her wits, so you can give the 'avenging father' bit a rest. Second, if you had waited five seconds, you would have heard him say that she was a friend to him, and he never laid a hand on her. Then, you would ask how she got pregnant, and I would tell you that the police are investigating her gynecologist for doing that to her and two other girls, one of them being my stepdaughter."

Mr. Rogers absorbed this information, then bowed his head. "I'm sorry," he muttered.

"Louder," Pop said. "He's felt your fist, he deserves to hear your apology."

"I'm sorry," he said, much louder this time. Turning to Cindy, he asked, "Why did you come here, if he isn't the father?"

"Because my stepdaughter lives here."

"I don't get it."

"The reason Cindy was so adamant that she didn't know how she got pregnant," Pop explained, "is because she and my stepdaughter are a couple."

Mr. Rogers fixed a look on Cindy. It was the same look he'd given Pat, right before slugging him.

I wasn't the only one who picked up on it, either. "Don't even think it," Pop said, "or you'll be seeing a proctologist to have my shoe removed."

As Mr. Rogers left, Pop turned to Cindy. "I get the feeling we should make arrangements for your stay here to be a little more permanent. What do you say?"

"I'd like that, Mr. Pennant."

"First rule: If we do this, I'm not Mr. Pennant anymore, I'm Pop."

"Okay,... Pop."
1121111111111111111111.title: Continue

11211111111111111111111.content:
While Pop went to call the police to report what happened, Teresa, Cindy, and I followed Pat upstairs to the bathroom. As he used toilet paper to try and stop the bleeding, Cindy went over and hugged him, “Pat, I-I’m so sorry; I never thought he’d do something like that.”

“It’s okay, Cindy.” Hugging Cindy back, not caring about the bloodstains on her shirt, Pat said, “It’s not your fault.”

“I guess it’s a good thing we never told him you were a lesbian.” Coming up behind Cindy, I said, “If Pop hadn’t stopped him, who knows what he would’ve done to me.”

The four of us stayed in the bathroom talking for a few minutes, until Cindy and I left to get Cindy a change of clothes. Once we were back in my room, Cindy turned and gave me a kiss. We kissed for a few moments, until I broke the kiss. Looking at me, Cindy said, “I knew Daddy was having trouble with me being pregnant; I-I just never realized he’d go this far.”

“You don’t have to worry about that now, babe.” As Cindy changed her shirt, I said, “Pop’s going to do everything he can to keep you safe.”

“Do you really think they’ll let me stay here?” turning to me, Cindy said, “It’s not like Pop and your Mom are my legal guardians or anything.”

“After what your dad did to Pat, and tried to do to me, I’m sure the courts won’t have a problem making my folks your legal guardians.”

“Won’t that make things, you know, weird for us?” pausing, Cindy said, “I mean, your folks would be the legal guardians of your girlfriend.”

“If our relationship can survive both of us being pregnant, I think we can figure something out.”

Giving me a quick kiss, Cindy said, “I love you.”

“I love you, too.” Smiling, I said, “Now let’s go check on Teresa and Pat.”

As the two of us walked down the hall, I heard voices coming from Pat’s room. Also hearing the voices, Cindy said, “Are they in Pat’s room?”

“Sure sounds like it.”

The two of us stopped outside of Pat’s door. I peeked inside to find Pat and Teresa sitting on the bed, their backs turned to us, as Pat was showing Teresa his comic book collection. I was about to barge inside to tell Pat to stop bugging Teresa, when I heard her say, “Remind me to show you my limited edition Marvel #1.”

“You have Issue #1? I’m so jealous!”

I stepped back from the door when I realized the two were bonding over a surprising, mutual interest in comics. I was shocked, however, to see Teresa slowly place her arm on Pat’s shoulder. Was something developing between them?
11211111111111111111111.title: Upstairs

info.brief_description: Cassie Pennant is 16, pregnant,... and a virgin.
info.description:
In this story, we follow 16-year-old Cassie Pennant as she deals with the news that she is pregnant, even though she has never had sex.

Of course, you've gotta have rules:

1) The story is told in 1st person, past tense.

2) At least make an effort at correct punctuation and grammar.

3) Do not kill off the main character.

4) Cassie is pregnant. She is not delusional, nor is she making it up.

5) Likewise, this isn't a "I didn't think he counted" situation. When she says she never had sex, it's with the same certainty that she would have when she says she's never been to the moon.

6) Keep it PG-13. Nudity is okay. Some strong language is okay, but don't push it. Sex is okay, but don't go into detail.
